question: Automatic reporting of OUT time is generated by ____.
a: a. doors closed and brakes OFF
c: c. the brakes being released
d: d. closure of the forward entry door

question: Entering "99" in the flap setting field when requesting a TPS via ACARS, allows the TPS to _____
b: b. search for a flap setting that will allow standard thrust
c: c. search for the best short field takeoff flap setting

question: Following the initial ACARS load closeout, what will be uplinked to the FMS?
a: a. Both ZFW and takeoff CG.
b: b. Only CG to prevent an unsafe Stabilizer Trim setting.
c: c. Only ZFW to prevent a takeoff above ATOW.
d: d. Nothing will be uplinked to the FMS, only to the printer.

question: Takeoff with frost on the fuel tank underside of the wing surfaces is permitted provided the frost does not exceed ____ inch.
When encountering turbulence, maintain an airspeed of ____ knots or ____ Mach.
During flight in light to moderate turbulence, the autopilot and/or autothrottle may be ____ unless performance is objectionable.
c: c. disconnected

question: The maximum demonstrated crosswind component on a dry runway is ____ knots.
If heavy rain is encountered, ignition Start Switches should be positioned to ____.
c: c. CONT

question: When weather conditions indicate windshear could be a threat. You should use ____ power for takeoff.
c: c. 22K max

question: The ram air doors normally modulate to full OPEN when the aircraft is ____.
a: a. in flight with flaps not fully retracted or on the ground
c: c. in flight with flaps retracted
d: d. operating both packs in high flow

question: The APU can supply bleed air for the pack up to ____.
a: a. 20,000 feet or 8000 feet if the APU is also providing electricity
b: b. 17,000 feet or 10,000 feet if the APU is also providing electricity
c: c. 20,000 feet or 12,000 feet if the APU is also providing electricity

question: The mix manifold receives air from the ____.
a: a. left pack, right pack, recirculation fan, and pre-conditioned air
b: b. left pack, right pack, and pre-conditioned air only
c: c. left pack and right pack only
d: d. right pack, recirculation fan, and pre-conditioned air only

question: What is the primary source of conditioned air for the cockpit?
c: c. Mix manifold

question: The primary purpose of the recirculation fans is to ____.
a: a. increase airflow at greater cabin differential pressure
b: b. provide overheat detection downstream of the packs
c: c. reduce air conditioning pack load

question: Equipment cooling is provided for electronic equipment in the ____.
a: a. E & E bay and flight deck area
b: b. E & E bay and aft cargo compartment
c: c. E & E bay only
d: d. E & E bay and forward cargo compartment

question: The equipment cooling system has ___________ fan(s).
c: c. 1 supply and 1 exhaust

question: Air from the preconditioned ground source enters the air conditioning system through the ____.
c: c. mix manifold

question: Engine low pressure bleed air is provided by the ____ stage, and engine high pressure bleed air is provided by the ____ stage air.
c: c. 9th/13th

question: Each A/C pack has ____ controllers for pack temperature control.
If the primary equipment cooling fan fails, what indications would be displayed?
a: a. No indications - the standby fan turns on automatically.
b: b. Master Caution light, the related equipment cooling OFF light, and the OVERHEAD annunciator light on the System Annunciator Panel
c: c. Master Caution light and horn

question: In the event of a single pack failure at altitude, the remaining pack is capable of maintaining cabin pressure and comfort at an airplane altitude of _____.
c: c. 37,000 feet

question: The APU will supply bleed air for ____ pack(s) ____.
c: c. all three, in flight

question: Inflight, normal air conditioning system operation would be ____.
a: a. one pack from two engine bleed sources
b: b. two packs from one engine bleed source
c: c. both packs from APU
d: d. each pack from its associated engine bleed source

question: Which single bleed source is permitted to supply air to both packs on the ground?
c: c. An engine bleed or APU

question: The ram air system operates automatically to provide cooling for ____.
b: b. the E & E compartment on the ground
c: c. the heat exchangers
d: d. the right pack alternate air source

question: For maximum cooling (of the pack) the ram air inlet doors modulate toward the _________.
c: c. mid position
d: d. ram air inlet doors do not modulate

question: Deflector doors on the ram air system are used on the ground to __________.
a: a. increase airflow through the ram air doors
b: b. prevent slush ingestion on takeoff or landing
c: c. allow for smooth air flow over the heat exchangers
d: d. prevent backflow of air over the heat exchangers

question: The deflector doors on the ram air system are fully extended ____.
a: a. inflight with the gear extended
b: b. inflight with the flaps extended
c: c. on the ground only
d: d. on the ground, or inflight with the flaps extended

question: Zone temperature is controlled by introducing the proper amount of trim air into the__________.
c: c. the pack temp control valve
d: d. modulating the ram air inlet doors

question: Failure of the primary and standby flight deck zone temperature controls will cause the ____ to illuminate.
c: c. ZONE TEMP, MASTER CAUTION, and AIR COND annunciator lights

question: Inflight, the forward cargo compartment is heated by air drawn around it by the ____.
c: c. equipment cooling system

question: The temperature selector adjusts the desired zone temperature between a range of approximately ____ degrees.
When either the primary or standby pack temperature controller fails, what indications will be displayed?
a: a. PACK and MASTER CAUTION lights only
b: b. MASTER CAUTION, and AIR COND SYSTEM ANNUNCIATOR lights
c: c. PACK, MASTER CAUTION, and AIR COND SYSTEM ANNUNCIATOR lights on recall
d: d. PACK and ZONE TEMP lights

question: If the FWD or AFT cabin ZONE TEMP lights illuminate indicating an overheat this will cause the associated ____ valve to close.
c: c. trim air modulating

question: The associated PACK light, Master Caution, and AIR COND annunciator will illuminate when ______.
a: a. pack controller failure and all temperature selectors placed OFF
b: b. pack overheats or dual pack controller failure
c: c. pack trips caused by primary controller failure
d: d. all temperature selectors are placed OFF

question: What fault indications cannot be reset with the trip reset button?
c: c. BLEED TRIP OFF

question: The ZONE TEMP light, Master Caution, and AIR COND annunciator lights will illuminate for ____
a: a. an overheat in the duct leading to any of the three zones
b: b. a dual temperature controller failure in the CONTROL CAB zone
c: c. any single temperature controller failure in any zone during a RECALL test

question: At the same time this light illuminates, what other indications do you get?
a: a. Only the Master Caution light will illuminate.
b: b. AIR COND will illuminate on the left System Annunciator Panel.
c: c. The right System Annunciator Panel will illuminate AIR COND on recall only.
d: d. The Master Caution light illuminates and the right System Annunciator Panel shows AIR COND.

question: Both this light and the Master Caution lights are illuminated. What happens to the Left pack?
a: a. If both the Primary and Standby left pack controls fail, then the left pack valve automatically closes.
b: b. The left pack valve will stay open even if the left pack overheats.
c: c. The left pack valve will close if sensors detected excessive temperature in that pack.
d: d. The left pack valve closes due to pack overpressure.

question: Inflight, with the left pack valve closed due to excessive temperature, what other actions automatically occur in the Air Conditioning System?
a: a. The right pack switches to "high air flow" if flaps are up.
b: b. The right pack switches to "high air flow'' regardless of flap position.
c: c. The right pack switches to "high air flow" only if flaps are extended.
d: d. The right pack stays at "normal air flow" rate un1il the left Engine Bleed Air Switch is selected OFF.

question: What caused this light to illuminate? The Master Caution fights and the AIR COND light on the System Annunciator Panel also illuminate.
a: a. An overheat has occurred in the AFT Cabin trim air supply duct, and the associated trim air modulating valve opened
b: b. An overheat has occurred in the AFT Cabin trim air supply duct, and the associated trim air modulating valve closed.
c: c. The AFT zone temperature control failed.
d: d. The Right Electronic Controller has failed.

question: What is now controlling the right Air Conditioning Pack output temperature?
a: a. The right pack output temperature is now controlled by the AFT temp controller only.
b: b. The right pack output temperature is now controlled by the FWD temp controller only.
c: c. The right pack output temperature is now controlled by the average setting of the FWD and AFT Cabin Temperature controllers.
d: d. The right pack output temperature cannot be controlled.

question: What effect will this condition have on the left pack?
a: a. The left pack will produce the coldest of the three controllers.
b: b. The left pack will produce the average of the FWD and AFT cabin temp controllers.
c: c. The left pack will produce the coldest of the FWD and AFT cabin temp controllers.
d: d. The left pack output will be controlled by the CONT CAB temp controller.

question: If this light illuminated only on Recall. ____.
a: a. both the Primary and Back-Up Flight Deck Zone Temperature Controllers have failed
b: b. only one of the CONT CAB Zone Temperature Controllers has failed
c: c. both the Right and Left Electronic Controllers have failed
d: d. An overheat has occurred in the CONT Cabin Trim Air Supply Duct and the associated Trim Air Modulating Valve closed.

question: This light illuminated only during Recall and the TRIM AIR Switch is selected ON. Which statement, below, most accurately describes flight deck air conditioning operation.
a: a. The CONT CAB Trim Air Valve is stuck full open.
b: b. One of the CONT CAB Zone Temperature Controllers has failed.
c: c. The left pack produces an air temperature that satisfies the setting controlled by the CONT CAB. Temperature Selector.
d: d. The Aft Cabin Zone Temperature Control Valve is stuck full open.

question: If this light illuminated due to an overheat condition in the applicable zone supply duct, the MasterCaution Lights will also illuminate; and ____.
a: a. the AFT CAB trim air modulating valve closes
b: b. the FWD CAB trim air modulating valve closes
c: c. the CONT CAB trim air modulating valve closes
d: d. none of the trim air modulating valves close

question: With this configuration, what temperatures do the packs command?
a: a. The left pack produces an output of 75 degrees and the right pack produces an output of 65 degrees.
b: b. The temperature selectors are ignored.
c: c. Packs produce an air temperature that satisfies the zone which requires the most cooling.
d: d. Temperatures are averaged for each pack output.

question: With this configuration what temperatures do the packs command?
a: a. Temperatures have an averaged output.
b: b. The Forward cabin temperature selector is ignored.
c: c. Left pack produces 75 degrees, right pack produces 65 degrees.

question: With all the temperature selectors positioned to OFF, the packs will adjust for cabin demand. In this case, which statement is most correct?
a: a. The pack outputs will average.
b: b. The left pack outputs will adjust for a demand of 75 degrees, and the right pack output will adjust for a demand of 65 degrees.
c: c. The left pack outputs will adjust for a demand of 65 degrees, and the right pack output will adjust for a demand of 85 degrees.

question: Placing the trim air switch off will:
a: a. Cause both packs switch to high flow.
b: b. Cause the trim pressure regulating and shutoff valve
c: c. Cause the left pack temperature to be controlled by the Cont Cab temp selector and the right pack by the Fwd and Aft temp selectors.
d: d. Both b & c are correct.

question: While accomplishing the QRH procedure for a PACK light illuminated, why do you select a warmer temperature on all three temperature selectors?
a: a. Reduce the workload on the affected air conditioning pack
b: b. This causes the pack to revert to high flow
c: c. Open the pack valve
d: d. To extinguish the Pack light

question: The minimum pavement width required for a 180 degree turn is _____ feet.
What are the thrust ratings of the CFM 56-7B26 engine?
c: c. 22K

question: The system that controls and monitors engine parameters is the _____.
c: c. Autothrottles

question: The B737-800 is limited to a maximum takeoff weight of _____ pounds.
The B737-800 is limited to a maximum landing weight of _____ pounds.
What is the maximum operating altitude for the B737-800?
What is the maximum zero fuel weight?
(MAX) PSEU Light has been replaced with the ____ light:
c: c. MAINT

question: Emergency Lighting will automatically illuminate when the switch is in the ARMED position and _____.
a: a. AC power is turned off
c: c. DC Bus 1 fails

question: The emergency exit lights may be illuminated by a switch on the ____.
c: c. forward flight attendant panel

question: The amber emergency light NOT ARMED illuminates when the switch is in ____.
c: c. the ARMED position

question: Exterior lights, except position and anti-collision, should be extinguished by the time you reach ____.
c: c. 18,000 feet

question: Wing illumination lights ______________________.
a: a. are not installed on AA aircraft
b: b. are installed on the fuselage and illuminate the leading edge of the wing
c: c. are required "ON" when using wing anti-ice

question: The APU provides ____.
c: c. both electrical power and pneumatic air

question: The APU start cycle may take as long as ____.
c: c. 60 seconds

question: With the APU operating, turning OFF the battery switch will cause the APU to ____.
a: a. continue running without supplying electrical power or bleed air

c: c. automatically only

question: The APU can be started with electrical power from ____.
a: a. AC Emergency Bus or the airplane battery
b: b. TR Bus 1 and the AC Emergency Transfer Bus
c: c. AC Transfer Bus 1 or the airplane battery

question: With the APU blue MAINT light illuminated, the crew ____.
a: a. should move the start switch to OFF momentarily
b: b. should restart the APU after the auto shutdown
c: c. pull the APU fire handle
d: d. may continue to use the APU if needed

question: The APU EGT is displayed on the ____.

question: In order to start the APU on a cold, dark airplane, the ____.
a: a. Battery switch must be ON and the cockpit APU fire handle must be IN. The ground control panel fire handle may be PULLED
b: b. battery switch must be ON, the cockpit APU fire handle must be IN, and the ground control panel fire handle must be IN
c: c. Battery switch must be OFF. The cockpit APU fire handle and the ground control panel fire handle may be IN or PULLED
d: d. Ground Service Bus must be powered by an external power source

question: The APU can be started at altitudes up to ____ feet.

c: c. OFF, ON, and START

question: An automatic APU shutdown will occur for ____.
a: a. overspeed, fire, high oil pressure
b: b. low oil pressure, fault, overspeed
c: c. fault, overheat, low oil quantity
d: d. fire, high oil pressure, fault

question: Which of the following will cause the APU to shut down?
c: c. Fault

question: The maximum altitude for use of APU bleed air and electrical power is _____ feet.

If airborne and the battery is the only available power source, APU start attempts are not recommended above ____ feet.
On the ground, the APU ____.
a: a. attempts to carry a partial electrical load
c: c. will power both transfer busses
d: d. will not power the main busses

question: You observe these lights on after starting the APU, and they were not on prior to start. Which statement is the most correct?
a: a. The APU failed a self-check overspeed test and should not be used.
b: b. The APU had an overspeed fault and shut down automatically.

question: If this light came on shortly after placing the APU start switch to on, __.

question: After shutting off the APU that has an illuminated Overspeed light, the light will __.
b: b. remain on for five minutes and then extinguish

d: d. blink to indicate that the system needs to be reset

question: After 3 consecutive aborted start attempts on the APU, how long of a cooling period must be observed?
c: c. 3 mins

question: (MAX) The blue MAINT light:
a: a. DOOR light has replaced the MAINT light on the control panel.
b: b. Has not changed in function.
c: c. Monitors APU door only.
d: d. Now monitors Exhaust Gas Temperature since the gauge has been removed.

b: b. Mode S or Mode C
c: c. Mode A only
d: d. Mode S, Mode C, or Mode A

question: Which of the following traffic displays is NOT a function of TCAS?

question: A TA is indicated by an aural _____ and the traffic annunciation appears on the ____.
c: c. Climb Climb""/Primary Flight Display

question: An RA is indicated by an aural alert for corrective action and a ____.

question: If the selected range on the NAV display does not permit the display of a TA or RA, what annunciation appears on the NAV display?

b: b. the expanded MAP or center MAP
c: c. the expanded VOR

question: What system provides N1 limits and target N1 for the A/T?
c: c. AFDS

question: The A/P automatically disengages ____.
a: a. with loss of Standby Hydraulic System pressure only

c: c. when moving the STAB TRIM AUTOPILOT Cutout Switch to NORM
d: d. when pressing either TO/GA switch with a single A/P engaged above 2000 feet RA

question: A Mode Control Panel switch illuminates to indicate mode ____ and that mode can be ____ by pressing the switch again.
c: c. selection, selected

c: c. turning both F/D¤s OFF and disengaging the A/P

a: a. both A/Ps are engaged below 1500 feet RA

a: a. dual FDs being annunciated on the FMA

question: What does an amber CWS P above the attitude indicator mean?
a: a. A flight director mode is limited to pitch only.

c: c. A fault exists in the pitch mode.

question: What does an amber CWS R above the attitude indicator mean?
a: a. Control wheel steering, roll, is engaged

c: c. A fault exists in the roll mode.
d: d. A fault exists in the autopilot system.

question: The three flight mode annunciator displays above the attitude indicator are ____.
b: b. lateral navigation, vertical navigation, autopilot status

question: A/P engagement is inhibited when ____.
a: a. the Stab Trim Auto Pilot cutout switch is in cutout
b: b. force is applied to the control wheel
c: c. the A/P disengage bar is down
d: d. any of the above occur

question: Engaged flight modes are displayed in what color?
c: c. blue

question: LNAV will automatically disconnect if ____.
a: a. the end of an active route is reached
b: b. a route discontinuity is reached
c: c. another roll mode is selected
d: d. any of the above occurs

question: The crew is alerted to an altitude deviation when ____ feet from the selected MCP altitude.

a: a. at the bottom of the PFD
b: b. at the top of the ND
c: c. near the top of the PFD below the FMA

question: When TO/GA is engaged for takeoff, where are the pitch command bars positioned initially?
b: b. Pitch bars are not in view until 60 knots.
c: c. 10 degrees nose up

question: In LNAV, the AFDS intercepts and tracks the active FMC route if ____.
a: a. on any heading and within 3 NM of the active route segment

question: THR HLD on the Flight Mode Annunciator means ____.
b: b. FMC is controlling throttle movement
c: c. the pilot can set the throttles manually
d: d. both A and B are correct

question: What are the indications when deviating from a selected altitude by more than 200 feet?
a: a. An aural alert sounds and the altitude alert turns red and begins to flash.
b: b. The altitude scale turns amber.
c: c. The altitude scale turns red.

question: An altitude deviation will continue to warn the crew until _____.
a: a. the master caution light is reset
b: b. the RECALL button is pushed
c: c. the A/P is disconnected
d: d. deviation is less than 200 feet, more than 900 feet, or a new altitude is selected

question: The right FMC becomes the Primary FMC when ____.
a: a. the B Autopilot is selected
b: b. the FMC Source Select Switch is BOTH ON R
c: c. the left FMC fails
d: d. Both B and C are correct.

question: After TO/GA is selected on a go around, the FD will command an initial pitch attitude of approximately _____ degrees.
On a go around after the first push of either TO/GA switch, the thrust levers advance to reduced go around N1 to produce _____ fpm to _____ fpm rate of climb.

c: c. N2

question: Altitude alerting is inhibited ____.
a: a. when level change is selected for landing
c: c. with the gear down

question: If windshear is encountered on takeoff or go-around, the F/D pitch bar commands a pitch attitude with an initial target airspeed of _____ kts.
If during a windshear encounter, the vertical speed decreases to 600 feet/min or less, an attitude of _____ degrees is commanded by the pitch command bars.

c: c. wing flap placard speeds

question: If a speed selected on the MCP is greater than the maximum speed allowed, ____ appear(s) on the display?
c: c. a flashing 8

question: If a speed selected on the MCP is lower than the minimum speed allowed by the AFDS and A/T, ____ appear(s) in the MCP speed display?
c: c. a flashing A

question: The ____ mode(s) is/are inhibited after glideslope capture in APP mode.

question: Pressing the APP Switch __.
a: a. illuminates the APP switch light
b: b. arms the AFDS for LOC and GS capture

d: d. does all of the above

question: On a go around after the first push of either TO/GA switch, the thrust levers advance to OM2 AUTO reduced go around N1 to produce __ fpm to __ fpm rate of climb.
During a go around, the roll command is _____.
c: c. the existing ground track (FMA is blank) when TO/GA was engaged

question: After the Localizer and Glideslope capture, ____ will not work to get out of the approach mode.
b: b. disengaging autopilots and turning off both FD switches
c: c. retuning the VHF Receiver

question: During a Go Around, pressing the TO/GA switch two times will disengage ____.
a: a. both autopilots and auto throttles

c: c. one autopilot

question: The Captain is flying the aircraft with Autopilot A engaged. He transfers control of the aircraft to the FO. To switch the Autopilot from A to B _____.
a: a. switch off the left Flight Director control switch
c: c. switch off the right Flight Director control switch
d: d. all Flight Directors and Autopilots must be off to select B Autopilot

question: As you switch to 1he B Autopilot, what must be done to switch the Master FCC to the Right Side?
a: a. Do nothing, it will switch when Autopilot B is selected.
b: b. Turn the left Flight Director switch OFF and then ON.
c: c. Turn the right Flight Director switch OFF and 1hen ON.
d: d. Turn off both Flight Director switches and reset the right one first.

question: After switching from one Autopilot to the other, _______.
a: a. all the MCP modes will disengage

c: c. the pitch mode will revert to CWS P
d: d. the roll mode will revert to CWS R

question: With the VNAV Mode selected, the auto throttle will ______.
a: a. be controlled by MGP Speed
c: c. revert to FMS Speed Mode
d: d. engage in a TO/GA Mode

question: At cruise altitude, you've been cleared for descent. After resetting the altitude window on the MCP, you select a vertical speed of 1000 Ft/Min. What will control the Autothrottle?
a: a. It will revert to FMS Speed.
b: b. II will respond to MCP Speed.
c: c. It will retard to idle and stay there.
d: d. It will go to the N1 Mode.

question: In this scenario, the _____ mode is controlling the Autothrottle.

question: With the display as shown, the Autopilot is operating in in the __ mode.
c: c. CMD

question: The pitch mode is being controlled by _______.
c: c. ALT HOLD

question: If the pilot now selects LNAV, how would this change the FMA?

b: b. If greater than 5NM and more than 180° intercept angle of track, the FMA will change to LNAV

question: (MAX) When roll attitude exceeds ____ degrees of bank, the MAX Roll Command Alerting System (RCAS) a guidance cue is displayed on the PFD and HUD, indicating the correct upset roll recovery direction?

question: Which PA system announcements will override all others?

question: How is the cockpit voice recorder tape manually erased?
a: a. Airplane on the ground, brakes set, then turn OFF the battery switch.
b: b. Momentarily press the ERASE button with the airplane on the ground and the brake set.

question: The Radio Tuning Panel offside tuning light (white) indicates ____.
a: a. the Captain is tuning VHF #2 from his/her panel
b: b. the First Officer is tuning VHF #1 from his/her panel

question: Placing the service interphone switch to the ON position ____.
a: a. enables all flight attendants to talk to each other
b: b. adds all external jacks to the service interphone system

question: Volume controls for the overhead speakers on the audio control panel ____.
a: a. cannot control the volume of audio warnings
c: c. raises the volume on audio warnings to a preset level
d: d. lowers the volume on audio warnings to a preset level

question: With the Captains audio system degraded, which statement is correct?
b: b. All audio warnings are inhibited.
c: c. Audio warnings can only be heard by the First Officers headset.
d: d. Audio warnings cannot be heard through the Captains audio control panel or overhead speaker.

question: How will you know if the Radio Tuning Panel has failed?
a: a. The Radio Tuning Panel OFF Switch will illuminate.
b: b. PANEL FAIL will be displayed in the active and standby windows.
c: c. The Off Side Tuning Light will illuminate with XXXX displayed in the active and standby windows.
d: d. There will be dashes in the active and standby windows of the radio panel control head.

question: With Standby Power OFF light illuminated, you could power the standby busses directly from the battery by ____.
a: a. placing the standby power switch to BAT
c: c. leaving the transfer bus switch in AUTO
d: d. placing the battery switch to ON

question: DC power is supplied by ____.
a: a. voltage regulators and the transfer switch
b: b. the static inverter and the battery
c: c. transformer rectifier units, the battery charger, and the battery

question: Normally, the AC electrical system is run ____.
c: c. alternately between AC Transfer Bus 1 and AC Transfer bus 2

question: The static inverter is powered by ____.
c: c. DC Bus #1

question: The Ground Service Switch is located _________________.
a: a. next to the Galley Power Switch
b: b. on the forward attendant panel
c: c. on the aft attendant panel

question: The DC Cross Bus Tie Relay will open ____.
b: b. at glideslope capture during a flight director or autopilot ILS approach
c: c. when power for one DC bus fails
d: d. when the Battery Switch is moved to BAT

question: Circuit breakers are allowed to be pulled and reset ____.
a: a. if necessary for flight, only after a one minute cooling period
b: b. anytime on the ground or in flight
c: c. only for galleys or the fuel quantity indicating system
d: d. only if specified in a QRH procedure

question: What conditions cause the GND POWER AVAILABLE light to be illuminated?
a: a. Ground power is plugged in and available.
b: b. Ground power is plugged in and meets airplane power quality standards.
c: c. Ground power is plugged in, and the Ground Power Available switch is moved to ON.
d: d. Ground power is plugged in and already in use.

question: After engine start, the crew forgets to put the generators on line and uses the APU to power the Transfer Busses for takeoff. If the APU fails, the ____.
a: a. galleys are load shed for the duration of flight
b: b. generators are automatically placed on line
c: c. system reverts to standby power only
d: d. airplane loses all electrical power

question: On the ground with the APU powering the electrical systems, the APU GEN OFF BUS light will be _____.
c: c. OFF until you turn off the APU when it comes back on
d: d. ON until you select GEN 1 or GEN 2 ON

question: When moved to OFF, the BUS TRANSFER switch will ____.
a: a. isolate the AC and DC Busses on Electrical System 1 from the AC and DC Busses on Electrical System 2
b: b. isolate the AC system from the DC system
c: c. immediately shift the primary source of power for the AC Standby Bus from AC Transfer Bus 1 to AC Transfer Bus 2
d: d. disconnect the battery from the electrical system

question: In a normally operating AC electrical system, if the Bus Transfer Switch is moved to OFF, ____.
a: a. both Transfer Busses are unpowered
b: b. the AC Standby Bus reverts to battery through the inverter
c: c. power is removed from AC Transfer Bus 2 only
d: d. and if a generator subsequently fails, the bus ties will not close to transfer power

question: If the Standby Power "OFF" light illuminates, it means ____ is/are not powered.
c: c. the Battery Bus
d: d. one or more of the above

question: With standby electrical power only, the Captain will be able to fly _____ instrument approaches.
c: c. ILS

question: The AC standby bus can be powered by ____ if its normal power source fails.
b: b. the battery (through the static inverter)
c: c. Generator Bus No. 2

question: During an ILS approach, the cross bus tie relay automatically opens at glideslope capture to ____.
a: a. prevent single bus failure from affecting both navigation receivers and flight control computers
b: b. provide more power to the AC Standby bus
c: c. ensure that the Standby DC bus is powered

question: With a normally operating electrical system, placing the Battery Switch OFF ____.
a: a. removes power to the Battery Bus and the Switched Hot Battery Bus
b: b. removes power to the Switched Hot Battery Bus only
c: c. causes all electrical power to fail
d: d. unpowers all five busses in the standby electrical system

question: The DC Standby Bus can be powered by ____.
a: a. TR1, TR2, TR3, and the battery
b: b. AC Transfer Bus 1 and the battery
c: c. the battery only

question: Under what conditions can External power be used to power one AC Transfer Bus, and the APU the other Transfer Bus?
a: a. Only if you are on the ground
b: b. If the Bus Transfer Switch is in AUTO
c: c. If volts and frequencies check good
d: d. No condition. The electrical system will not allow it.

question: What does an illuminated ELEC light, on the AC and DC Metering Panel, mean?
a: a. A fault exists in the AC or standby power system.
c: c. A Standby Power or DC system fault has occurred.

question: The BAT DISCHARGE light illuminated indicates excessive battery discharge is detected with the battery switch on. How long will the battery provide power?
a: a. A fully charged battery provides a minimum of 40 minutes of standby power.
b: b. A fully charged battery provides a minimum of 15 minutes of standby power.
c: c. A fully charged battery provides a minimum of 30 minutes of standby power.
d: d. A fully charged battery provides a minimum of 35 minutes of standby power.

question: If the TR Unit light illuminates, inflight, it means ____ have failed.
b: b. TR3 has failed or TR1 and TR2
c: c. TR2 has failed or TR1 and TR3
d: d. TR1 has failed or TR2 and TR3

question: If the TR Unit light illuminates on the ground, it means ____ has/have failed.
b: b. TR3 has failed or TR1 and TR2
c: c. TR2 has failed or TR1 and TR3
d: d. TR1 has failed or TR2 and TR3

question: In flight, if an engine generator fails, load shedding ____.
a: a. is designed to shed the main busses only
b: b. would not occur if the Bus Transfer Switch is in AUTO
c: c. would occur in the main busses first, followed by all galleys
d: d. is designed to shed electrical load incrementally

question: If you see these lights in flight, what do they indicate?
a: a. Power has been lost to both AC Transfer Busses.
b: b. The Standby AC Bus is not powered.
c: c. The Standby DC Bus is not powered.
d: d. The Battery Bus and Switched Hot Battery Bus are not powered.

question: The QRH directs the crew to attempt a start of the APU. If the aircraft is below 25,000 ft, the APU __.
a: a. Will not start since AC power is lost
b: b. Will not start because there is no fuel boost pump pressure
c: c. should start with battery power and fuel suction feed
d: d. should start using power from TR1 and fuel suction feed

question: APU power is not available. Since we are on emergency power, the Right IRS is on DC power and will remain on DC for ____ minutes.
With these lights illuminated, ____.
a: a. the AC Transfer Bus 1 is no longer powered
b: b. the AC Transfer Bus 1 is being powered by lDG 2
c: c. the AC Transfer Bus 2 is no longer powered
d: d. all the busses are powered

question: Which of the following is also true?
a: a. AC Main Bus 1 is still powered.
b: b. AC Standby Bus is being powered by the static inverter.
c: c. TR1 is powered.
d: d. All Galley Busses are still powered.

question: Since AC Transfer Bus 1 is dead, ____.
a: a. the battery is not being charged because AC Ground Service Bus 1 is also dead
b: b. the battery is being charged through the static inverter
c: c. TR3 is powering the Battery Bus and charging the battery
d: d. the battery charger is being powered by AC Ground Service Bus 2

question: In flight, these two lights indicate that _____.
b: b. engine 1 has failed and the APU failed to start
c: c. engine 1 has flamed out
d: d. either IDG 1 has failed or engine 1 has flamed out

question: Which statement is true?
a: a. IDG 2 is powering both AC Transfer Busses.
b: b. IDG 2 is powering AC Transfer Bus 2, while the APU is powering AC Transfer Bus 1.
c: c. IDG 2 is powering AC Transfer Bus AC Transfer Bus 1 is not powered.
d: d. Neither of the AC Transfer Busses are powered.

question: Since IDG 1 is not powering AC Transfer Bus 1, the SOURCE OFF light remains illuminated. The QRH directs a start of the APU and a connection to the affected bus. Once this step is accomplished, what happens on the left side?
a: a. SOURCE OFF and GEN OFF BUS lights would extinguish.
b: b. SOURCE OFF and GEN OFF BUS lights would remain illuminated.
c: c. SOURCE OFF light and APU light would extinguish, and the GEN OFF BUS light would remain illuminated.
d: d. SOURCE OFF light remains illuminated and the GEN OFF BUS light extinguishes.

question: The illumination of this light means ___.
a: a. DC Bus 1 is not powered
b: b. DC Bus 2 is not powered
c: c. the Switched Hot Gallery Bus is not powered
d: d. Either the AC Standby Bus, the DC Standby Bus, the Battery Bus. or any combination of these three busses has lost power

question: Select the correct answer to solve this problem.
a: a. You should be able to repower the affected bus by moving the Battery Switch to BAT.
b: b. You should be able to repower the affected bus by moving the STANDBY POWER switch to OFF.
c: c. You should be able to repower the affected bus by moving the STANDBY POWER switch to BAT.
d: d. There is no way to re-power the affected bus.

question: The QRH directs moving the STANDBY POWER switch to BAT. What source are you now using to re-power the affected bus?
c: c. AC Main Busses 1 and 2

question: Inflight, engine #1 experiences a loss of all thrust. This situation would also be accompanied by which of the following electrical system lights on the overhead panel.
b: b. #1 GEN OFF BUS, SOURCE OFF and DRIVE lights.
c: c. #1 ENGIN E CONTROL light
d: d. A steady OIL FILTER BYPASS alert for Engine # 1

question: If the engine #1 experiences a loss of thrust, illumination of the #1 DRIVE light is the result of ____.
c: c. IDG Auto Disconnect

question: You have confirmed that the #1 Engine and IDG have failed. The ORH will direct the crew to start the APU. If the APU is to be used as an electrical source only, the maximum altitude for APU operation is __ feet MSL.

The aircraft has been struck by lightning. You observe these conditions on the Electrical Panel and the MASTER CAUTION and ELEC Annunciator Lights illuminated. Before any corrections are attempted, which of the following components is still available?
c: c. VHF NAV No.2

question: The crew can't restore normal electrical power and elects to divert and land ASAP. Focusing on the Left EFIS Control Panel, momentarily pressing the Radio Minimums Reset (RST) Switch ____.
a: a. Blanks the minimums display if the alert is active.
b: b. Resets the alert minimums annunciation.
c: c. If STD was displayed in the PFD Barometric Setting, resets the preselected barometric reference.
d: d. Resets the alert minimums annunciation and blanks the minimums display it the alert is active.

question: Since the aircraft is still on standby power, the Captain flies the approach and presses the Center (CTR) Switch on the Left EFIS Control Panel. This provides a full compass rose on the Left Nav Display in the __ Mode.
c: c. MAP
d: d. All of the above are correct.

question: If this combination of lights comes on, including the ELEC light on the overhead panel, _____.
a: a. resetting the Master Caution will not extinguish any of the lights
b: b. resetting the Master Caution will extinguish all of the lights, indicating a minor fault
c: c. resetting the Master Caution will not extinguish the ELEC light, thus the aircraft cannot be dispatched
d: d. and if the ELEC light does not extinguish after resetting the Master Caution, the aircraft can still be dispatched.

question: When illuminated, the ELEC light indicates ____.
a: a. a fault located in one or more of the AC main systems, and you cannot be dispatched
b: b. a fault exists in the DC or AC system and you can be dispatched
c: c. a normal situation, and it will go out after the APU is started
d: d. a fault exists in the DC or standby power systems and you cannot be dispatched

question: This ELEC light illuminates ____.
a: a. any time when faults exist and flaps are not up
b: b. only with the airplane on the ground
c: c. only on the ground alter landing
d: d. only on the ground with flaps not down

question: During the APU Start, without AC power available, this light illuminates and ____.
a: a. indicates the battery is extremely weak, but the APU start should be accomplished
b: b. is a non-normal situation because the APU starts with AC power
c: c. is a temporary situation that should resolve itself when AC power is connected
d: d. the situation leads to a possible APU hot start and therefore needs to be monitored closely

question: The APU is now started and AC power is applied. Assuming that everything is normal, the BAT DISCHARGE light should ______.
a: a. Extinguish indicating the battery charger is operational
b: b. remain on approximately five minutes before it will extinguish
c: c. take up to ten minutes to extinguish, depending on battery condition
d: d. extinguish immediately indicating TR3 is now charging the battery

question: If during flight, the master caution light and the electric annunciator alert you to the Bat Discharge light being on, ____.
a: a. this happens occasionally and the light should extinguish shortly when the battery charger reconnects
b: b. the battery charger is now charging the battery through the battery bus
c: c. the battery is possibly discharging while the battery charger switches to the number one ground service bus
d: d. the battery is indicating excessive discharge

question: On the B737, the nearest megaphone to the cockpit is located in the ____.
b: b. left side overhead bin at the rear of the aircraft
c: c. forward entry area aisle side storage space
d: d. right side overhead bin at the rear of the aircraft

question: The emergency exit door flight lock failed indications are inhibited until ____ seconds after the airplane is in the ground mode.
There are ____ over wing emergency exits on the B737.
The over wing emergency exits lock when ____.
a: a. 3 of the 4 entry/service doors are closed
c: c. the airplane air/ground logic indicates that the airplane is in the air or both throttles are advanced

question: There are ____ 56 person raft(s) installed in the ceiling of the aircraft.
What component regulates the engine to keep it within operating parameters?
b: b. The dual channel electronic engine control (EEC).
c: c. Flight Management Computer (FMC)

question: Thrust reverser operation is available below _____ altitude or when the air/ground sensor is in the _____ mode.
c: c. 10 feet/ground

question: A green "Rev" light above N1 on the upper display indicates that the ____.
a: a. reverser sleeve has not moved from stowed position
b: b. thrust reverser is in transit
c: c. thrust reverser is deployed
d: d. auto stow circuitry has activated

question: Each engine is equipped with _____ ignitors.
What are the methods of inflight restarting?
c: c. Air and crossbleed

question: The Fuel Used readout is displayed ____.
a: a. when the Fuel Flow Switch is moved to Used or Reset
b: b. at brake release just prior to pushback
c: c. upon touchdown through the ground sensing switch
d: d. automatically whenever the airplane is refueled

question: The amber ENGINE CONTROL light functions on the ground below ____ KIAS prior to takeoff, or approximately _____ seconds after touchdown.
How can you tell if the EECs are in the normal mode?
a: a. The amber OFF is in view.
b: b. The white OFF is in view.
c: c. The amber ON is in view.
d: d. The white ON is in view

question: The indication of a properly deployed thrust reverser after landing is a/an ___ displayed above N1.
c: a. white REV

question: How is an EGT exceedance displayed after engine shutdown?
c: c. A red box

question: The EEC selects approach idle ____.
a: a. when the engine start switches are moved to FLIGHT position
c: c. inflight when the flaps are in landing configuration or engine anti-ice is turned on for either engine
d: d. when N1 and N2 fall below preset limits

question: The EGT digital readout and EGT round dial indications are red, indicating what?
a: a. MAX go around thrust has been selected.
b: b. MAX continuous thrust EGT has been selected.
c: c. Start limit has been exceeded.
d: d. MAX takeoff thrust has been selected.

question: The EEC provides ____ protection in the normal mode.
c: c. N1, N2, and N3

question: The EEC will abort the engine start on the ground for ____.
c: c. an EGT start limit exceedance
d: d. either A or C above

question: You will see an ENG FAIL alert ____.
a: a. in flight with the start lever in CLOSED
b: b. when the applicable start selector switch faults
c: c. when N2 drops below 50% and the start lever is in IDLE
d: d. on the ground only - it is not dispatchable

question: The approximate engine starter cutout speed and the indication of engine starter cutout is ____.
a: a. 56% N2, Engine Start Switch moves to AUTO and START VALVE OPEN light extinguishes
b: b. 50% N2 and starter trips to OFF position
c: c. 60% N2 and the starter trips to OFF
d: d. 57% N2 and ENGINE FAIL light extinguishes

question: The engine thrust reversers are operated ____.
c: c. electrically

question: The cockpit indications of a thrust reverser malfunction are a Master Caution
a: a. a bell, and severe yaw
b: b. a horn, and an auto-restow light
c: c. severe yaw, and an auto-restow light
d: d. ENG System Annunciator light, and REVERSER light

question: If a wet start is detected, the EEC aborts the start ____ seconds after the start lever is moved to IDLE.
Is it possible to use a reverser after landing with the REVERSER light on?
b: b. Only if the standby rudder system powers the reversers
c: c. In REVERSE IDLE only

question: Engine maximum and minimum limits are displayed in ____.
b: b. amber when RESET is pressed
c: c. white text numbers

question: The ____ position provides ignition to selected igniter(s) when the engine is running and flaps are not UP.
c: c. OFF

question: In stabilized cruise flight, the EEC automatically displays the light to the right, which indicates that the #1 EEC is in the _____ mode.
c: c. Soft Alternate

question: In this mode, what parameters is the EEC using to control the # 1 engine?
a: a. The atmospheric condition sensed when the engine was started.
c: c. The atmospheric data from the altitude set in the pressurization FLT AL T window.
d: d. The last valid flight conditions that the EEC sensed before it went into the Soft Alternate mode.

question: What protection is the EEC providing the #1 engine in this mode?
a: a. Low oil pressure red line limits
c: c. Exceeding N1, N2 redline limits

question: This light at right indicates that the #1 EEC is in the ____ mode.
c: c. Normal

question: The #1 EEC is moved from the Soft to Hard Alternate (ALTN} mode indicated at right by ____.
a: a. moving the #1 engine throttle to IDLE
b: b. pressing the #2 EEC switch to ALTN
c: c. moving the start switch to cutoff
d: d. pressing the #1 EEC switch to ALTN

question: What type of data is the EEC using to control the engine while in the Hard AL TN Mode? ____.
a: a. The last valid flight conditions sensed.
b: b. A preprogrammed alternate mode thrust schedule.
c: c. Current altitude data supplied by the ADIRUs.
d: d. Standard day temperature and pressure data.

question: If this light illuminates during flight. ______,
a: a. Shut down the # 1 Engine, it is in reverse
b: b. The auto stow system has been activated
c: c. Operate the #1 Engine at idle to prevent it from going into reverse
d: d. Do not use the #1 reverser when landing

question: During landing rollout, with this light illuminated, the reverser ______.
c: c. will deploy partially
d: d. will not stow after deployment

question: If this light is illuminated during landing rollout while the reverse lever is stowed, you should _____
a: a. Shut down the #1 engine immediately or damage could occur.
b: b. expect this light to stay on for 16 seconds after the reversers are stowed
c: c. expect this light to extinguish ten seconds alter the thrust reverser is commanded to stow
d: d. expect this light to extinguish when the thrust reverser is commanded to stow (when the isolation valve closes) plus 20 seconds.

question: If this light illuminates approximately 30 seconds after touchdown, ______.
a: a. It should be ignored, it is normal
b: b. the light will stay on after #2 engine is shutdown
c: c. it should be written up in the log book, even if the light does go out after shutting #2 engine down
d: d. and if the light extinguishes, no action is required

question: If the #2 Engine control light illuminates in flight, what steps should be taken? ____.
a: a. Place both EECs in the hard mode.
b: b. Place the #2 EEC in the hard mode.
c: c. The light is inhibited during flight.

question: If this light illuminates during taxi, prior to takeoff. ______.
a: a. continue with flight. No maintenance action required
b: b. it indicates that the EEC is switched to the Soli AL TN mode
c: c. return to the gate. Maintenance action is required
d: d. it indicates the EEC is switched to the Hard ALTN mode

question: If this condition exists during takeoff, above 80 knots and below 400 feet RA. ______.
a: a. The three light capsules will flash for 10 seconds, then only the Oil Filter Bypass light will remain illuminated
b: b. the Oil Filler Bypass light will only illuminate steadily
c: c. all three indicators illuminate steady during takeoff above 80 knots
d: d. only the Low Oil Pressure light illuminates during takeoff above 80 knots

question: If this light illuminates in flight above 400 feet RA, ______.
a: a. shut down the #2 engine immediately
b: b. all three indicators will flash for 10 seconds then the Oil Filter Bypass Light will remain illuminated
c: c. retard the #2 throttle. then shut the engine down

question: This light indicates _____.
b: b. fuel filter clogged due to ice
c: c. impending bypass of oil filter

question: (MAX) Available N1 Thrust Ratings for LEAP-1B Engines are:
c: c. 28K with a 10% and 20% de-rate option.
d: d. New EEC automatically selects correct thrust rating.

question: (MAX) The EECs will shut down the engine for:
a: a. Overspeed from exceeding engine structural design limits, only on the ground.
b: b. Overspeed from exceeding engine structural design limits, both in flight and on the ground.
c: c. High Thrust event on the ground.
d: d. Both b and c above.

question: (MAX) Bowed Rotor Motoring (BRM):
a: a. Selected by pushing the BRM switch on the Overhead Panel.
b: b. Designed to straighten the rotor shaft which will naturally “bow” due to thermal buildup after the engine is shutdown.
c: c. There is no Starter usage limits when MOTORING.
d: d. Both a and b above.

question: (MAX) The REVERSER AIR/GRD light is illuminated when:
a: a. When reverse thrust for the respective engine is unavailable.
b: b. Operates the same as on NG aircraft.
c: c. Illuminated when reverser air/ground protection is lost.
d: d. When a reverser is commanded to deploy in flight by the pilot.

question: ____ fire extinguishing bottle(s) is/are available for use on the APU.
If the battery switch is OFF, the APU has ____.
a: a. no fire extinguishing or detection
b: b. both fire extinguishing and detection
c: c. fire detection

question: Placing the Test Switch in the FAULT/INOP position tests the _____.
a: a. fire bottle squib discharge circuits
c: c. fault detection circuits for both engines and the APU
d: d. fire detection loops on both engines and the APU

question: What indicates the engine fire extinguishing agent has been discharged?
b: b. An amber LOW PRESSURE light
c: c. A green extinguisher test light comes on for the respective engine.
d: d. An amber L or R BOTTLE DISCHARGE light

question: Fire detection for the engines and APU is available when the battery switch is ______.
c: c. OFF

question: In flight, failure of a cargo compartment smoke detector loop will ____.
a: a. illuminate the Cargo Detector Inop Light
b: b. cause a Master Caution/overheat detection alert
c: c. not be indicated unless both loops fail
d: d. illuminate the Cargo Detector Fault light on recall

question: The engine fire extinguishing bottles are discharged ____.
a: a. by pulling and manually turning the fire switch
b: b. by pressing the discharge button next to the fire switch
c: c. by pulling the fire switch twice
d: d. automatically for the engine on fire

question: The APU fire bottle is discharged ____.
c: c. by pulling and rotating the APU fire switch
d: d. by pressing the discharge button

question: How do you extinguish a wheel well fire?
c: c. Both of the above.

question: Pulling the APU fire switch ____.
a: a. closes the APU Inlet Door
b: b. deactivates the fuel solenoid and closes the APU Fuel Shutoff Valve
c: c. closes the APU Bleed Air Valve
d: d. accomplishes all of the above

question: The ____ are equipped with smoke detection equipment.
c: c. galleys

question: The APU wheel well fire warning horn operates on the ground with the battery switch ____.
c: c. OFF

question: If the APU fire detection system is inoperative (APU DET INOP), the APU will _____.
b: b. shutdown automatically for a fire if battery power is available
c: c. shutdown automatically if both loops are inoperative
d: d. shutdown automatically for a fire if only one loop is inoperative

question: Following a dual loop failure on an engine, you would expect to see ____.
c: c. a FAULT light
d: d. All of the above are correct.

question: Some of the indications for an engine fire warning are Master Caution and OVHT/DET annunciator lights, the Engine OVERHEAT light, the Master FIRE WARN light, and the red Fire Switch light. What is another?
c: c. The APU Det INOP light

question: Both engines are operating in flight. In addition to the indications to the right, the Master FIRE WARN lights illuminate and the Fire Warning Bell sounds. Which of the following statements is correct?
a: a. Engine #2 Overheat has been detected.
b: b. Both of the Engine # 1 Overheat/ Fire Detector Loops are inoperative
c: c. Engine #1 Fire Handle automatically unlocks.
d: d. Engine fire detection is now powered by the Hot Battery Bus.

question: In addition to the Engine #1 fire warnings already described, the crew notices the indications at right on the Upper Display Unit. Which statement below best describes these EGT indications?
a: a. The maximum continuous EGT limit has been exceeded on Engine #1.
b: b. The maximum takeoff EGT limit has been exceeded on Engine #1.
c: c. Engine lt1 is operating at a condition below sustainable idle.
d: d. This is a false indication because the EEC provides EGT redline exceedance protection.

question: Following the QRH procedure, the crew pulls (fully extends) the Fire Handle. Which statement below is not correct when Fire Handle #1 is pulled up?
a: a. One discharge squib on each lire extinguishing bottle is armed.
b: b. The thrust reverser for Engine #1 is disabled.
c: c. Both the Engine Fuel Shutoff Valve and the Spar Fuel Shutoff Valve close for Engine #1.
d: d. The left Bus Tie Breaker is tripped open.

question: What light(s) on the Overheat/Fire Detection panel will cause the Master Caution light to illuminate?
c: c. Engine Overheat lights or APU Det Inop

question: These indications, along with the Fire Bell, OVHT/DET Annunciator, Master FIRE WARN and MASTER CAUTION lights activate during the pre-flight test of the Fire/Overheat warning. Select the most correct statement.
a: a. This is a proper test if AC power has not yet been applied.
b: b. The ENG 1 and ENG 2 OVERHEAT Lights should not be illuminated during this test.
c: c. This is a proper test with the AC Busses powered normally.
d: d. The WHEEL WELL light does not illuminate with the test switch in OVHT/FIRE position.

question: Suppose instead that a FAULT light illuminates during the Fire/Overheat Warning test and the #1 engine Fire Handle and ENG 1 OVERHEAT lights do not illuminate. Select the most correct statement.
a: a. The number one engine has one operative Fire Detector Loop and one inop Overheat Detector loop.
b: b. The number one engine Overheat Detector Loop is operative but the Fire Detector Loop is inop.
c: c. The number one engine has one Overheat Detector Loop and one Fire Detector Loop inop.
d: d. The number one engine has one Overheat/Fire Detector Loop inoperative.

question: What is the proper course of action for any Fire and Overheat System test with an inoperative loop?
a: a. Put the OVHT DET Switch to A and then B and re-test the system at each position. The FAULT light illuminates when the inoperative loop is selected. Select the good loop for both OVHT DET switches and leave the panel in this configuration.
b: b. Keep the OVHT DET Switch in NORMAL. The Engine Fire and Overheat Detection system will work normally and needs no further testing.
c: c. Maintenance must be called to test the Engine Fire and Overheat Detection system since this requires a very complex array of switch positions.
d: d. Select the OVHT DET Switch from NORMAL to A since this condition is always an indication of a Loop B fault

question: While in flight, you observe these indications. The Fire Bell is also sounding. What is your conclusion?
a: a. The number 1 engine indicates an overheat condition only.
b: b. The number 1 engine indicates a fire condition.
c: c. The number 1 engine has as a single loop detection failure.
d: d. The other crew member is performing an independent loop lest.

question: Before consulting the QRH procedure, the crew elects lo reset the Fire Warning System by pressing the Fire Warning BELL CUTOUT Switch or either Master FlRE WARN Light. Which of the following indications will now occur?
a: a. The Fire Warning Bell will silence. Also, the MASTER CAUTION Lights, the OVHT/DET Lights, ENG 1 OVERHEAT light and the #1 Engine Fire Handle Light will extinguish.
b: b. The Fire Warning Bell and the Fire Horn in the Main Wheel Well will silence. The ENG 1 OVERHEAT light and the #1 Engine Fire Handle Light will extinguish.
c: c. The Fire Warning Bell will silence and the Master FIRE WARN lights on the glare shield will extinguish and reset.
d: d. The Fire Warning Bell will silence and the Master FIRE WARN, MASTER CAUTION, and OVHT/DET annunciator lights will extinguish.

question: After resetting the Fire Warning System you reduce the # 1 Engine Throttle to idle thrust and the #1 Engine Fire Handle Light extinguishes. Under these circumstances, _____.
a: a. Action must be taken to first override a locked Fire Handle before pulling the applicable Fire Handle. Do not rotate the pulled #1 Engine Fire Handle
b: b. action must be taken by pulling up on the appropriate Fire Handle and rotating that Fire Handle to discharge a fire bottle
c: c. the engine fire and overheat conditions no longer exist, so leave the engine in idle thrust for the remainder of the flight
d: d. Action must be taken to prevent the shutdown of the engine when the applicable Fire Handle is pulled. Manually unlock the #1 Fire Handle Override and then pull, but do not rotate the appropriate Fire Handle

question: The primary flight controls consist of _____.
b: b. elevators, yaw damper, and ailerons
c: c. ailerons, elevators, and spoilers

question: The primary flight controls are normally powered by hydraulic system(s) ____.
c: c. B only

question: ____ can be extended by the Standby Hydraulic System in Alternate mode.
c: c. Elevators

question: If a FEEL DIFF PRESS light illuminates, ____.
a: a. depressurize the A or B hydraulic system
b: b. No crew action is required in flight. Continue normal operations.
c: c. immediately turn off the associated flight control switch
d: d. place both Flt Control switches to STBY RUDDER

question: When the Flaps/Slats Electronics Unit (FSEU) detects a trailing edge asymmetry or skew condition, the FSEU closes the TE Flap Bypass Valve, ____.
a: a. illuminates the amber FLT CONT annunciator light, and displays a needle split on the Flap Position Indicator
b: b. and displays a needle split on the Flap Position Indicator
c: c. and freezes the TE Flap needles in place
d: d. illuminates the green EXT light, and displays a needle split on the flap position indicator

question: On aircraft 3AA - 3LB, load relief for the Trailing edge flaps is only provided for flaps ____.
c: c. 25 and 30

question: During alternate flap operation, the TE flaps are positioned using ____ power.
c: c. electrical

question: The SPEED BRAKE lever will automatically move to the down detent, and all spoilers will retract, if ____.
a: a. the TOGA button is pressed
b: b. either throttle is advanced after landing
c: c. wheel spin up drops below 60 knots
d: d. wheel spin up drops below 50 knots

question: In the event hydraulic systems A and B fail, the ailerons and elevators can be operated ____ and the rudder must be operated by the ____ system.
c: c. mechanically (manually), standby

question: If the aileron control system is jammed, the ____ can still fly the aircraft using the ____ after force is applied to the control wheels and they break free.
c: c. FO, spoilers

question: With the trailing edge flaps at 1, the leading edge slats are ____.
b: b. in the full extend position
c: c. retracted

question: Hydraulic System A pressure to the Main Rudder PCU is reduced at airspeeds above approximately ______ knots.
The horizontal stabilizer is normally powered _____, but may also be operated _____.
c: c. electrically, manually

question: Leading edge devices can be _____ by the Standby Hydraulic System if System B fails.
c: c. retracted

question: On the ground, speed brakes normally use _____ to destroy lift and make braking more effective.
c: c. both flight and ground spoilers
d: d. compression of the left main landing gear strut to deploy the ground spoilers

question: In aircraft 3AA-3LB, the LE devices will go to the full extend position when you select _____ or greater with the flap handle.
The _____ of the Stab Trim Indicator corresponds to the allowable range of trim settings for takeoff.
b: b. APL NOSE UP selection settings
c: c. 3 entire scale

question: The autoslat feature is available in flight
c: c. with trailing edge flaps selected to 30-40
d: d. with trailing edge flaps selected to 1, 2, or 5

question: If we move the flap lever from 5 to 10, but the leading edge devices all stay in the extend position, the ____ Light will be illuminated.
c: c. AUTO SLAT FAIL

question: The maximum altitude for extension of flaps is ____ feet.
Leading edge devices are normally operated by ____.
c: c. Standby Hydraulic System
d: d. Hydraulic Systems A and B

question: Roll control is normally provided by the ailerons, assisted by _____.
c: c. autoslats
d: d. both A and B above

question: With the SPEED BRAKE Lever in the DOWN detent, how can the speedbrakes be deployed on landing?
a: a. The pilot can raise the lever manually.
b: b. The speedbrake is not available.
c: c. The speedbrake lever will automatically move to full up position when the reverse thrust levers are moved to reverse when above 60 knots.

question: The LE FLAPS TRANSIT light illuminated indicates _____.
a: a. leading edge devices are in transit
b: b. leading edge devices are not in the programmed position with respect to the trailing edge flaps
c: c. a leading edge device asymmetry

question: When using the SPEED BRAKE in flight, the speedbrake lever should _____.
a: a. be moved to the FLIGHT DETENT only
b: b. be moved to the UP position
c: c. be moved to any selling
d: d. be moved to the DOWN position

question: Speed Brake Load Alleviation System operates in flight under what conditions?
a: a. Flaps up, gross wt. greater than 155,000 lbs., airspeed greater than 320 kts
b: b. Flaps up, gross wt. less than 155,000 lbs., at all airspeeds
c: c. Whenever the airspeed limitations are exceeded for flaps 30 or 40
d: d. When any flap airspeed limitation is exceeded

question: If wheel spin-up is not detected by the air/ground sensors, the flight spoilers will deploy when _____.
a: a. the right main gear strut compresses
b: b. the left main gear strut compresses
c: c. any main gear strut compresses

question: ____ can be extended by the Standby Hydraulic System in Alternate mode.
c: c. Ailerons

question: During the origination pre-flight, this light illuminates alter the IRS Mode Selectors are to NAV. The “Flight Control Panel…CHECK” is accomplished by ____.
a: a. Calling Maintenance. The Speed Trim System has failed
b: b. resetting the Stab Trim to Zero
c: c. Doing nothing. This is a normal indication while the IRUs are aligning
d: d. resetting the light with the Press-To-Test Switch

question: This light and the Master Caution Lights sell-illuminate during taxi-out. Select the most correct statement.
a: a. Check the MEL or call Maintenance. There is a dual channel failure of the Speed Trim System.
b: b. No action is required. The Speed Trim System only works with the autopilot engaged.
c: c. No action is required. The Speed Trim System will operate 10 seconds after takeoff.
d: d. Reset the SPEED TRIM FAIL light by pressing either of the Master Caution Lights.

question: If instead, this light illuminates once you are in flight, the autopilot _____.
a: a. has lost the ability to trim the aircraft
c: c. can only be engaged in CWS P Mode
d: d. if engaged, has now disengaged and cannot be re-engaged

question: You observe these lights on the system B hydraulic panel. The QRH directs you to use the Alt Flaps procedure. After arming the All Flaps master switch, you extend the trailing edge flaps electrically. The leading edge flaps are extended ______.
a: a. by Hydraulic System A and the PTU
b: b. by the hydraulic fluid in the standby system
c: c. electrically by the alternate flaps toggle switch
d: d. automatically when you arm the alternate flaps master switch

question: While extending the flaps electrically through the 5 degree flap position, if you still observe these lights, ____.
a: a. there is a disagreement between the flap handle and the LED's
b: b. the LEDs are still in transit
c: c. the flap gage is indicating an erroneous position
d: d. the flaps have not approached the flaps 10 degree position or beyond

question: When the flaps have been lowered to 15 degrees with the ALT system and a missed approach has been executed, the _____.
a: a. TE flaps can be retracted with the ALT system but not the LE devices
b: b. TE flaps can be retracted with the ALT system while the LE devices will retract with the PTU
c: c. TE and LE flaps will retract with the ALT system

question: When positioning the flaps for takeoff from UP to 1, the crew noticed this condition. What could have caused this malfunction?
c: c. Skewed T.E. Flap

question: The __ protects the flaps in this condition.
c: c. EEC

question: The FSEU protects the flaps during ____ operation.
c: c. both Normal and Alternate Flap
d: d. The FSEU does not provide any flap protection.

question: As you advance the thrust lever for takeoff, would you get an intermittent horn with the LEDs positioned as indicated?
a: a. NO. The LED's are not part of the takeoff warning system.
b: b. NO. The TE Flaps are set at 5 Degrees.
c: c. Yes. The LED's are not in the proper position.
d: d. No. If the parking brake is released.

question: The previous condition has now been corrected. The takeoff warning sounds again. What else could cause this?
a: a. Stab trim in green band and auto throttle switch not armed.
b: b. Parking brake released and RTO not selected.
c: c. Stab Trim not in green band or parking brake lever set.
d: d. Stab Trim in green band and Stab Trim Cutout Switches in normal.

question: With the TE Flap/Leading Edge Devices set, Stab Trim in the green band, parking break off, and speed brake handle stowed you still have a takeoff Warning Horn. What else could be causing this?
a: a. You must press TO/GA to silence the horn.
b: b. An over wing Exit Door did not lock properly.
c: c. Spoiler(s) are not fully down.
d: d. Trailing Edge Flaps are at a 15 degree setting.

question: During normal operations with these two FLT CONTROL switches in the ON position. They control pressure to the respective _____.
c: c. aileron only

question: After loss of system A. the QRH directs you to move the A FLT CONTROL switch to STBY RUD. This action will pressurize the ______.
a: a. aileron, elevator, and rudder systems
c: c. Standby Rudder and the #1 thrust reverser

question: With this switch in STBY RUD position how would you know if the standby rudder valve is open?
a: a. The low pressure light under the B FLT CONTROL Switch extinguishes.
b: b. The Standby HYD Low Quantity light illuminates.
c: c. The Low pressure light under the A FL T CONTROL Switch extinguishes.
d: d. Elevator Feel Diff light extinguishes.

question: With the loss of B Hydraulic System, the yaw damper will ____.
a: a. remain operating from the A hydraulic System
b: b. be inoperative causing the Yaw Damper Light to illuminate
c: c. be inoperative, but the Yaw Damper Light will not be illuminated until the Flt control B switch is moved to STBY RUD
d: d. cause the Yaw Damper Switch to trip off

question: Placing the B FLT CONTROL switch to STBY RUD will cause the YAW DAMPER switch to ______.
a: a. pressurize the A Hydraulic system making it fully operational
c: c. trip OFF and illuminate the Yaw Damper Light
d: d. allow you to reconnect the Yaw Damper by selecting the Yaw Damper switch on

question: Subsequently, the A Hydraulic System also fails. How would you gain control of the Standby Yaw Damper?
a: a. Turn the Yaw Damper Switch ON.
b: b. Ensure both A and B Flight Control Switches are in the Standby Rudder Position and then place the Yaw Damper Switch ON.
c: c. Check that the B System Low Pressure light is illuminated.
d: d. You cannot recover the Standby Yaw Damper with a Feel Diff Light illuminated.

question: With the STAB TRIM positioned as indicated, what would happen when the throttles are advanced for TO with all other systems set properly?
a: a. An intermittent horn would sound.
b: b. A steady horn would sound.
c: c. There would be no alert since this is the proper setting for TO.
d: d. The trim would automatically go to the proper setting.

question: If the trim was set to 10 units nose up and then the throttles are advanced for takeoff. What kind of alert would you get, if any?
c: c. A Stab out of Trim Light

question: While applying nose down trim, the electric trim stops. How can you continue to trim if you need more nose down trim?
a: a. Speed trim system will fix the problem.
b: b. Have the other pilot push the elevator forward.
c: c. Trim manually.
d: d. Engage autopilot and trim again.

question: (MAX 8) Fly-by-wire Spoiler system provides the following new features.
a: a. Maneuver Load Alleviation (MLA), Landing Attitude Modifier (LAM) and Coordinated Flare Cue landing assistance.
c: c. Elevator Jam Landing Assist System.
d: d. Both b and c above.

question: (MAX 8) Emergency Descent Speed Brakes system (EDS):
a: a. Generates additional drag to allow the Max to capture and maintain a glidepath similar to the NG.
b: b. Armed when the airplane is above 30,000 feet and the cabin altitude warning is active.
c: c. Fully automatic with operation transparent to the crew.
d: d. Both b and c above.

question: (MAX 8) The Spoiler Control Electronics Unit (SCE):
a: a. One sensor is applied to the Captains yoke and provides input for Coordination with the HUD Flare Cue during landing.
b: b. Translates signals from the speedbrake lever position sensor, the First Officer’s control wheel and other airplane data inputs.
c: c. Must be selected on during initial FMC setup.
d: d. Both a and b are correct.

question: (MAX 8) The Spoiler light indicates:
a: a. One or more spoiler pairs are inoperative.
c: c. The spoilers are not in the commanded position.
d: d. There is a fault in the fly-by-wire system.

question: (MAX 8) The Elevator Jam Landing Assist Switch is located on:
c: c. Fwd Attendant Panel

question: How many independent pitot-static systems are there on the 737?
The ____ provides inertial position and track data to the FMC.
c: c. GPS

question: Failures of flight instrument systems are displayed on the _____ by failure flags.
c: c. PFD and ND

question: The PLAN mode is presented _____.
c: c. either A or B

question: Maximum airspeed is displayed on the airspeed tape by a _____ bar.
c: c. black and amber

question: TCAS warning and avoidance annunciation, for an RA, is displayed on the _____.
c: c. PFD and ND

question: When STD is pressed on the inner BARO Switch on the EFIS Control Panel when climbing through FL180, the altimeter is automatically set to ____.
c: c. 1021 hectopascals
d: d. both B and C above

question: ____ display(s) flight path angle and drift angle on the PFD.
c: c. The angle of attack indicator (AOA)

question: ____ allow(s) the pilot to select the DU location of the PFD, ND, and engine instrument displays.
c: c. The Display Select Panel

question: A black and red bar at the top of the airspeed indicator represents ____.
c: c. Landing Gear Placard Speed
d: d. all of the above speeds

question: The standby instruments contain ____ information.
c: c. backcourse ILS

question: On the ground prior to starting the second engine, the CDS Fault amber light is illuminated on the PFD. Which statement is true?
a: e. A minor problem has occurred with the CDS, dispatch is permitted.
b: f. A non-dispatchable fault has occurred.
c: g. This is a normal annunciation, and dispatch is permitted.
d: h. If the light extinguishes, dispatch is permitted.

question: The CDS Fault light will only illuminate _____.
a: a. on the ground after both engines are started
b: b. anytime the aircraft is in flight
c: c. anytime the aircraft is on the ground
d: d. on the ground prior to the second engine start

question: If this light illuminates instead of the CDS Fault Light. __ .
a: a. a minor problem has occurred with the CDS, dispatch is permitted
b: b. a non dispatchable fault has occurred
c: c. this light only illuminates in flight
d: d. this fight will cause a Master Caution and the ELECT annunciations to illuminate

question: (MAX) What are some of the major differences of the new MAX Display System (MDS):
a: a. Range selector can now be rotated continuously.
b: b. The heading display expanded to a 180 degree compass rose.
c: c. Auxiliary area displays Engine Secondary Instruments
d: d. Both a and b above

question: The FMC receives inputs from many sources. Which of the following inputs are used?
c: c. airplane systems

question: With only one FMC available, the system is capable of calculating data accurately.
c: c.

question: The FMCs are completely independent and do not transfer or compare information between each unit.
c: c.

question: With the FMC source select switch in NORMAL, the right CDU is controlled by the _____.
c: c. FMC on the side with the MA light

question: When both FMCs are operating normally, each unit independently calculates its navigational position.
c: c.

question: The two control display units (CDU) allow pilots to input data only to their respective FMCs if the RNP value exceeds the ANP value.
c: c.

question: Which of the following is not used by the FMCs to determine position?
c: c. VOR/DME

question: With the loss of all navigational inputs to the FMC and GPS data is not available, how will it determine its position?
a: a. Computed off its last known position until landing.
c: c. Will compute off its last known position for 5 minutes.

question: Will the FMC use a combination or a single source to determine its actual position?
c: c.

question: The FMCs select a combination of inputs from navigation receivers to determine the position estimate. Which input has the highest weighted priority?
c: c. Scanning DME

question: During a VNAV PATH descent, the FMC will calculate a descent path based on _____.
a: a. airspeed and altitude constraints only
b: b. altitude constraints, airspeed, and end of descent point
c: c. airspeed and end of descent point only

question: During a derated takeoff, a further reduction by an assumed temperature can be taken.
c: c.

question: The STA switch on the Displays Control Panel will display all ____ on the nav display.
b: b. high and low altitude NAVAIDs if the range is selected to 40 miles or less
c: c. NAVAIDs but LOC and NDB

question: The IDENT page is accessed from the ____.
c: c. INIT/REF page, INDEX page, IDENT prompt, or at ground power-up.

question: Initial position can be entered on the POS INIT page by which of the following?
b: b. Reference airport, with or without specific gate
c: c. Manually entered lat/long

question: The PERF Performance Initialization (PERF INIT) page provides the means to enter aircraft weight, temperature, and wind parameters. What are the minimum parameters that must be input for the FMC to operate?
c: c. All blank lines

question: The selected approach reference speed will automatically update as aircraft weight changes.
c: c.

question: On the approach/reference (APP/REF) page, current gross weight can be manually entered.
c: c.

question: In addition to the approach reference speed displayed on the APP/REF page, which additional information is displayed?
c: c. Approach freq, ident, and course
d: d. B and C are correct

question: When multiple waypoints or NAVAIDs with the same identifier are in the database, the FMC will automatically display all waypoints.
c: c.

question: Which page is used to display SIDs and STARs?
c: c. MENU

question: When the final load closeout is received, the pilot must check that the _____ has been entered on the PERF page for FMC calculation.
c: c. takeoff weight

question: Thrust limits for takeoff, climb, cruise, and go-around must be selected manually.
c: c.

question: The thrust reduction altitude, where automatic thrust reduction from takeoff to climb limit occurs, is fixed at 1000 feet AGL, and cannot be changed.
c: c.

question: The ENG OUT prompt displays single-engine climb speeds and maximum continuous NEngine-out data is advisory only and cannot be executed.
c: c.

question: Lateral navigation will engage when (1) you are laterally within ___ nautical miles of the active route leg, and (2) you are outside of ____ miles if on an intercept heading of less than ___ degrees, and the intercept will occur prior to the fix.
Waypoints beyond the active leg can be removed from the LEGS page by _____.
a: a. pressing the DELETE key, then line select the waypoint to be removed
b: b. pressing the CLEAR key, then line select the waypoint to be removed
c: c. moving a subsequent waypoint up in sequence and thus removing all intervening waypoints

question: A holding pattern is constructed by entering the holding waypoint in the _____.
a: a. MENU page, then select HOLD
b: b. HOLD AT box on LEGS page
c: c. LEGS page

question: When a STAR is selected for an airport, the transition is also automatically selected.
c: c.

question: To select a non-precision approach procedure that is contained in the database, the pilot selects the _____ page.
c: c. DESCENT

question: A VNAV SPD descent can automatically revert to a PATH descent during ____.
a: a. initial descent from the T/D point if an altitude restriction will be violated
c: c. engine out operations
d: d. a STAR, approach transition, or approach leg with a vertical angle

question: The alternate destinations page (ALT DEST) does not provide the pilot a quick reference for _____.
c: c. fuel required

question: If the master (left) FMC fails, are LNA V and VNAV still available?
a: a. Yes, alter selecting FMC source selector to BOTH ON R.
b: b. No, conventional navigation is required.
c: c. Yes, LNAV and VNAV can be re-engaged if autopilot is in use or is selected.

question: Warnings and information about the nature of a situation are provided by _____ signals.
c: c. visual and aural

question: Immediate attention warning lights are _____.
c: c. yellow

question: Red warning lights may indicate ____.
a: a. engine, wheel well, and APU fires
c: c. landing gear unsafe conditions

question: Amber annunciator lights alert the flight crew of conditions which ____.
b: b. need no attention until RECALL is pressed
c: c. require timely attention

question: Informational alerts such as electrical power availability, valve position, equipment status, and flight attendant or ground communications are indicated by lights that are _____ in color.
c: c. amber

question: Some lights have a bright blue and a dim blue setting. The bright blue indicates a valve _____ and the dim blue indicates a valve _____.
a: a. in the selected position/stopped in-transit
b: b. in the selected position/moving to its selected position
c: c. moving to its selected position/in the selected position
d: d. moving to its selected position/stopped in-transit

question: Green lights indicate an extended configuration of ____.
a: a. takeoff trim in the proper range
b: b. both landing gear and leading edge devices
c: c. landing gear

question: Pushing the fire warning (FIRE WARN) lights or BELL CUTOUT for an engine fire ____.
a: a. extinguishes both FIRE WARN lights
b: b. silences the Fire Warning Bell
c: c. resets the system for additional warnings
d: d. accomplishes all of the above

question: Pushing a MASTER CAUTION light after it illuminates ____.
a: a. extinguishes that MASTER CAUTION light only
b: b. dims the system annunciator light(s)
c: c. resets the system for additional master caution conditions

question: An illuminated amber light on the System Annunciator Panel is on because of a malfunction outside of the primary viewing area of the pilots. To extinguish it, ____.
a: a. You can do nothing. It cannot be extinguished.
b: b. push the lights reset switch
c: c. push either MASTER CAUTION light
