d: d. push and release either system annunciator panel

question: The Landing Gear Warning Cutout Switch silences the landing gear configuration warning at flaps UP through ____ degrees.
The GPWS Inoperative (INOP) Light illuminates amber for ____.
c: c. invalid inputs

question: Generally, aural warnings will silence ____.
a: a. automatically when the associated non-normal condition no longer exists
b: b. when the System Annunciator or Master Caution lights are pressed
c: c. when the battery switch is cycled on and off
d: d. Both A and B are correct.

question: The System Annunciator Light Panels monitor system indications located on ____.
a: a. the Overhead and Fire Control panels
c: c. the EFIS displays

question: The _____ annunciator panel monitors the following systems: flight controls, IRS, fuel, electrical, APU, and overheat/detection.
c: c. right

question: The _____ annunciator panel monitors the following systems: anti-ice, hydraulics, doors, engines, overhead panel, and air conditioning.
c: c. right

question: The takeoff configuration intermittent warning can be cancelled only ____.
a: a. by pushing the landing gear horn cutout
b: b. when the configuration is corrected
c: c. by pulling the master warning circuit breaker
d: d. when the MASTER CAUTION light is pushed

question: Landing gear light indications are ____.
a: a. green light - gear is down and locked
b: b. Red light - gear is in disagreement with lever position, gear is not down and locked (below 800 ft RA and a thrust lever at idle.)
c: c. extinguished - gear up and locked

question: The Proximity Switch Electronic Unit (PSEU) monitors ____.
a: a. takeoff and landing configuration warnings
c: c. landing gear

question: Two independent Mach/airspeed warning systems sound a clacker when maximum speed is exceeded. The clacker will only be silenced when ____.
a: a. the MASTER CAUTION light is pushed
c: c. airspeed is reduced below VMO/MMO
d: d. the MASTER WARNING light is pushed

question: During takeoff, the PSEU light is inhibited ____.
c: c. until 90 knots

question: The stall warning stick shaker consists of ____.
a: a. an electro-mechanical device receiving data from the SWC (Stall Warning Computer)
b: b. a dual motor, serving both control columns
c: c. a single motor, serving both control columns
d: d. two separate motors, one on each control column

question: The stick shakers are designed to alert the pilots ____.
b: b. just before a stall develops
c: c. when a stall occurs
d: d. that angle of attack is approaching positive 10.0 degrees

question: On the fire test panel, we can test for ____.
a: a. APU, engines, and wheel well fire
c: c. operational fire bottle squibs

question: A valve that is not in its selected position will show up as a (an) _____ light.
c: c. dim blue

question: The MASTER CAUTION Lights will remain illuminated ____.
a: a. until reset or as long as the caution condition exists
c: c. as long as the problem exists

question: Single faults in certain redundant systems or some simple faults do not illuminate the MASTER CAUTION or the System Annunciator Light until _____.
a: a. after landing and shutdown of the engines
b: b. after landing with the flaps up
c: c. during a maintenance BITE check only
d: d. during recall of the system

question: When performing the Before Taxi/Taxi checklist, the PSEU light illumination on recall indicates _____.
a: a. a fault is detected in the landing gear locking system or the air/ground sensing system
c: c. the takeoff configuration warning horn will sound when the throttles are advanced toward takeoff power
d: d. a simple fault exists in the PSEU system

question: ____ will activate the takeoff warning system.
a: a. Autobrakes in the RTO position
b: b. Only two available sources of electrical power
c: c. SPEED BRAKE lever is not in the DOWN position

question: The red gear indicator light will be illuminated for ____.
b: b. landing gear not locked down with either throttle retarded to idle at any altitude
c: c. Both of the above

question: The flaps are set at 10 degrees, the landing gear is up, and you are above 800 feet RA. Which of the following statements is true about the landing gear horn?
a: a. The horn cutout button can silence the landing gear horn.
b: b. The gear horn cannot be silenced.
c: c. The horn will not sound.

question: The Mach/airspeed warning will sound the clacker anytime _____ is exceeded.
c: c. maximum maneuver speed, the amber band

question: The SMYD computers receive input from _____.
c: c. FMCs

question: How can you silence the Mach/airspeed warning horn?
a: a. Slow the airplane below MMO or VMO.
c: c. Reduce speed below maximum configuration speed.
d: d. Press the landing gear warning horn silence button.

question: A momentary altitude alert tone will activate ____.
a: a. approaching 200 feet of the altitude selected on the mode control panel
b: b. approaching 300 feet of the altitude selected on the mode control panel
c: c. on glideslope approaching 900 feet of the selected altitude on the mode control panel
d: d. approaching 900 feet of the altitude selected on the mode control panel

question: Deviations from the altitude selected on the mode control panel will cause a ____.
a: a. momentary altitude horn at 900 feet off altitude as set in the mode control panel
b: b. flashing amber display in the mode control panel altitude window
c: c. momentary altitude horn at 300 feet off altitude as set in the mode control panel
d: d. momentary altitude horn at 200 feet off altitude and an amber flashing box around the current altitude

question: A flashing amber box around the current altitude signifies ____.
a: a. an altitude deviation of 200 feet or more
b: b. a new altitude is set in the mode control panel
c: c. that you are in the altitude capture mode
d: d. an altitude deviation of 900 feet or more

question: Normal engine indications on the upper engine display are ____ in color.
c: c. green

question: Maximum engine limits are displayed in ____.
c: c. red

question: Upon engine shutdown on the ground at the end of the flight, an inflight exceedance will be ____.
a: a. stored in the maintenance computer only
c: c. shown by the display flashing amber
d: d. shown by a red box

question: A start valve failed to close on engine start. Which of the following will alert the crew?
a: a. Blinking start valve open alert for 10 seconds
c: c. Steady start valve open alert for 10 seconds

question: Some minor cautions or faults do not illuminate the MASTER CAUTION lights or system annunciator lights but are stored and presented later during ____.
c: c. a change in electrical power
d: d. during the completion of the electronic checklist

question: The landing gear configuration warning horn will activate at any altitude and cannot be silenced if a gear is not down and locked with the flaps set to ____ degrees with one or both throttles set to idle.
When illuminated on the HAP, the green AlII light means _____.
c: c. AlII mode is armed, but not yet engaged
d: d. a fault exists precluding AlII status

question: During an AlII approach, this light is illuminated below 1,000 feet. You should _____.
c: c. turn on both A/Ps
d: d. tum the aircraft over to the FO

question: When the NO AIII light is illuminated on the HAP, AlII _____.
b: b. mode is armed, but not yet engaged
c: c. mode is available and should be selected

question: When fuel is stored in the center and main tanks, both engines operating, all boost pumps on, fuel is supplied to the engines from ____.
c: c. the center tank

question: The main fuel tanks are serviced through ____.
a: a. either the over wing or single point refueling receptacles
c: c. the airplane fuel transfer system from the center tank only
d: d. a single point refueling receptacle

question: Each engine can be fed fuel from either or both main tanks through the fuel _____ valve.
c: c. bypass

question: With all fuel pumps ON, why does the center tank provide the fuel to the engines?
a: a. The center tank pumps are closer to the engine feed pumps.
b: b. The center tank pumps provide more pressure.
c: c. The fuel crossfeed valve is open.
d: d. One-way check valves prevent wing tanks from feeding.

question: With fuel pumps turned OFF, the APU fuel is suction-fed from ____.
c: c. the No. 2 main tank
d: d. Only what remains in the fuel lines. The APU cannot be suction-fed from a fuel tank.

question: Pulling a fire handle or placing an engine start lever in CUTOFF closes ____.
a: a. the engine fuel shutoff valve only
b: b. the spar fuel shutoff valve only
c: c. both the spar fuel shutoff valve and the engine fuel shutoff valve
d: d. both the spar fuel shutoff valve and the EEC shutoff valve

question: The Center Tank Scavenge Pump will activate when ____.
b: b. #1 Main Tank is about half full
c: c. Center Tank quantity reaches 3000 pounds

question: How many positions are there on the fuel flow/rate used switch?
c: c. Four - RATE, USED, RESET, REMAINING

question: A bright blue Crossfeed VALVE OPEN Light means the Crossfeed Valve is ____.
a: a. in transit or the valve position and CROSSFEED Selector disagree
c: c. open
d: d. in agreement with the position commanded

question: An amber FILTER BYPASS Light means ____.
a: a. impending fuel filter bypass due to a contaminated filter
b: b. impending fuel filter bypass due to ice
c: c. the fuel filter is being bypassed because of excessive pump pressure
d: d. the fuel filter is being bypassed because of low pump pressure

question: The Fuel Flow Used readout is updated for the next flight ____.
a: a. upon touchdown through the ground sensing switch
b: b. at brake release prior to pushback
c: c. automatically whenever the airplane is refueled
d: d. by use of the FUEL FLOW Switch moved to RESET

question: IMBAL means that the main tanks differ by more than _____ pounds.
CONFIG means that either engine is running and the fuel in the center tank is more than _____ pounds and both center tank pumps are producing _____ pressure.
c: c. 1,600/high

question: Will the CONFIG, IMBAL or LOW annunciation on the fuel gauges cause the MASTER CAUTION lights to flash?
c: c. Yes if 10% below the trigger values of the annunciation
d: d. Yes, but only during RECALL

question: The Fuel LOW Alert indicates fuel quantity in the related main tank is less than _______ pounds.
The maximum fuel temperature is ____ degrees C.
Random fuel imbalance between main tanks must not exceed ____ pounds for taxi, takeoff, flight, or landing.
The Nitrogen Generation System (NGS) Operability Indicator is located in the right wheel well. If the Degraded (blue) light is illuminated, it indicates ____________________.
a: a. a normal indication during preflight
b: b. NGS is operational, but is operating in a degraded condition, make an E-6 entry
c: c. the system is INOP, do not operate the airplane until the system is fixed
d: d. maintenance should de-activate the NGS system

question: The aircraft is in level cruise flight with this light illuminated. Both main tanks are full, and usable center tank fuel is 5000 lbs. All other conditions are normal. Which statement is valid?
a: a. The #1 engine will begin feeding from the #1 Main Fuel Tank.
b: b. The #2 engine will begin feeding from the #2 Main Fuel Tank.
c: c. Both engines will continue to feed from the Center Fuel Tank.
d: d. The #1 engine will automatically start feeding from the #2 Main Fuel Tank.

question: At the moment this Low Pressure light illuminated, which of the following statements is also true?
a: a. The Master Caution light will illuminate.
b: b. The Center Tank Scavenge Jet Pump system will no longer operate if needed.
c: c. Once the Center Fuel Tank is empty, there is no fuel pump pressure to #1 engine.
d: d. Fuel Crossfeed capability is not available.

question: The Fuel Control Panel is configured as shown. The center tank is empty and both main tank fuel quantities are above 8000 lbs. How does this affect the current operation of the fuel system?
a: a. No effect. The #1 Main Tank AFT pump pressure is sufficient to supply the engine.
b: b. Crossfeeding fuel from the #2 Right Main Tank is required to supply sufficient pressure for normal operation of engine #1.
c: c. Descend to a lower altitude to assist engine suction feed and prevent flame out of #1 engine.
d: d. Engine #1 must be shut down.

question: The aircraft is in level cruise flight end all fuel tank pump switches are ON. Both main tanks are full, and useable center tank fuel is 7000 lbs. All other conditions are normal. Which statement is valid with this light illuminated?
a: a. Both engines are still receiving fuel from the Center Fuel Tank.
b: b. The #1 engine is now being gravity (suction} fed.
c: c. The #1 Main Fuel Tank is now supplying fuel to the #1 engine.
d: d. You have lost all fuel pressure to the #1 engine.

question: The aircraft is in level cruise flight and all fuel tank pump switches are ON. Both main tanks are full and useable center tank fuel is 7000 lbs. If no action is taken, what will happen to the fuel quantity in each main tank?
a: a. The #2 Main Tank fuel quantity will remain constant and the #1 Main Tank fuel quantity will increase.
b: b. The #1 Main Tank fuel quantity will remain constant and the #2 Main Tank fuel quantity will decrease.
c: c. Both main tank fuel quantities will start to decrease.
d: d. The #1 Main Tank fuel quantity will start to decrease and the #2 Main Tank fuel quantity will remain constant.

question: Review the appropriate QRH procedure. It states if one center tank Low Pressure Light is illuminated, the Crossfeed Selector should be placed in open. Why is this action directed by the ORH?
a: a. An Airworthiness Directive mandates it.
b: b. This will cause the Right Center Tank Fuel Pump Low Pressure light to illuminate.
c: c. To prevent a fuel quantity imbalance.
d: d. The left center tank pump switch must be turned OFF, leaving insufficient pressure to supply center tank fuel to both engines unless the Crossfeed is open.

question: With the airplane in flight, what does it mean when this light illuminates?
a: a. The fuel temperature is too high.
b: b. There is no fuel pump pressure to the #1 engine.
c: c. An impending fuel filler bypass on #2 engine.
d: d. An impending fuel filter bypass on #1 engine.

question: What could cause this light to illuminate?
a: a. Ice formation on the Hydro Mechanical Unit (HMU).
b: b. Solid contaminants blocking the fuel filter.
c: c. Solid contaminants in the oil filler.
d: d. The EEC has moved to the alternate (ATLN) mode.

question: What action should be taken in flight when this light illuminates?
a: a. Turn ON the fuel heater.
b: b. Tum OFF the fuel pump pressure to the respective engine.
c: c. Consider landing at the nearest suitable airport.
d: d. No action required unless the same light on the other engine comes on, then land at the nearest suitable airport.

question: (MAX) An illuminated FUEL FLOW light alerts the crew of:
a: a. Difference between the actual engine fuel flow rate and the FMC expected fuel flow rate.
b: b. Significant difference between tank quantities.
c: c. FMC expected fuel flow rate exceeds a pre-determined threshold value for 5 consecutive minutes
d: d. Both a and c above.

question: (MAX) An amber FUEL DISAGREE message:
a: a. Displayed when there is a disagreement between the FMS calculated fuel and the measured total fuel for 15 continuous minutes.
b: b. Only valid after 1 hour flight time and condition
c: c. Message displays in CDU scratchpads.
d: d. Is displayed if the wrong Fuel Pump Switches are selected off during Fuel Balancing.

question: On aircraft prior to 3DM, look ahead terrain GPWS alerting ____.
a: a. provides alerts and displays of terrain relative to airplane altitude
b: b. is inhibited by an actual windshear warning (airplane in windshear)
c: c. does not account for man-made obstructions in 3AA through 3DL aircraft

question: Look ahead terrain alerts are based on ____.
b: b. barometric altitude, ground speed, and vertical flight path
c: c. terrain information stored in the database

question: Predictive windshear is active automatically ____.
b: b. when throttles are set for takeoff
c: c. within 5 NM of a windshear event

question: The predictive windshear symbol will appear in ____ mode(s).
a: a. VOR or APP in centered
c: c. Plan
d: d. MAP, Expanded VOR or APP

question: If windshear is predicted within 1.5 NM, ____.
a: a. the red word WINDSHEAR appears on both PFD/ND
b: b. the red visual windshear symbol appears on the ND (mode permitting)
c: c. An aural voice alert is heard.

question: Upon actual entry into windshear, ____.
b: b. the stick shaker automatically engages
c: c. go around power is automatically set
d: d. predictive windshear alerts are inhibited by an actual windshear warning

question: Upon Use of the terrain display is allowable for navigation.
c: c.

question: The HUD is activated by ____.
b: b. setting the NORM/MAN switch to NORM
c: c. placing the combiner screen in the breakaway position

question: In the HUD, the default glideslope angle displayed during initial power-up is ____ degrees.
If operational, the HUD ____.
a: a. must be used for all takeoffs and all approaches and landings to assist in tailstrike prevention
b: b. must be used for low visibility takeoffs and low visibility approaches in the Lower Minimums Program
c: c. combiner must be deployed and the intensity adjusted for ambient conditions in the mandatory regimes
d: d. must be used per all of the above

question: The HUD computer is programmed/controlled for each event ____.
a: a. on the CDU HUD menu
b: b. automatically upon executing the FMC approach selection
c: c. whenever the MCP APP button is pressed
d: d. when the nav is tuned and auto-identified

question: In addition to normal flight and navigation guidance, the HUD can also provide all of the following EXCEPT for ______.
c: c. windshear alerts

question: If the HUD combiner screen moves to the breakaway position, ____.
a: a. the bottom half of the image on the combiner screen becomes distorted
b: b. a FAULT message is displayed on the combiner
c: c. an ALIGN message is displayed on the combiner
d: d. the combiner symbology is blanked

question: An illuminated AIII light on the HUD Annunciator Panel indicates AIII mode is ____.
a: a. armed but not yet engaged
c: c. faulted

question: When the HUD NO AIII light is illuminated on the HAP, ____.
a: a. AIII mode has been armed and engaged
b: b. current approach conditions allow AIII operations
c: c. conditions have been detected which prevent AIII mode from being continued
d: d. AIII mode must be manually overridden to engage

question: When the HUD Combiner NORM/MAN switch is set to NORM, combiner screen brightness is adjusted ____.
a: a. only by the amount of light sensed by the ambient light sensor
b: b. by pressing the Declutter Switch
c: c. by the position of the DIM Control and the amount of light sensed by the ambient light sensor
d: d. only by the pilot using the DIM Control

question: For routine operations, the HUD must be used on takeoff until at least ____.
b: b. 500 feet AFL or Second Segment Climb, whichever occurs first
c: c. Final Climb Segment (clean configuration)

question: The HUD AIII mode must be selected up to approximately 7 seconds prior to reaching ____ feet AGL.
On approach, the HUD must be used no later than ____.
c: c. 500 feet AFL

question: Use of the HUD with an inoperative number 1 radio altimeter is prohibited.
c: c.

question: (MAX) The naming convention for the HGS modes have changed. Which of the following modes will be annunciated on the HUD when selected?
c: c. VMC, AII, AIII

question: (MAX) Which of the following is correct regarding The Aircraft Braking Scale and Pointer?
a: a. System uses a flexible distance scale depending on new Runway Remaining Guidance system.
b: b. If the current braking level is not sufficient to stop the aircraft in the remaining runway, the pointer will deflect to a position at the top end of the scale in the warning area and flash.
c: c. The Aircraft Braking Scale and Pointer are displayed only upon de-rotation after landing.
d: d. Both a and b are correct.

question: The hydraulic systems on the 737 are designated as ____.
c: c. System A, System B, and Standby

question: Normal hydraulic system pressure is ____ psi.
Which of the following components are normally powered by Hydraulic System A?
c: c. Yaw Damper

question: Which of the following components are normally powered by System B?
c: c. Landing Gear

question: If either System A or System B is lost, the remaining system can power ____ with no decrease in airplane controllability.
c: c. the primary flight controls

question: Turning Engine 1 or Engine 2 Hydraulic Pump Switches OFF ____.
a: a. disconnects the pump shaft from the engine accessory case
b: b. blocks fluid input to the pump
c: c. removes electrical power to the pump
d: d. blocks pump pressure output to the components

question: Moving a FLT CONTROL switch to the STBY RUD position ____.
b: b. arms the ALTERNATE FLAPS Position Switch
c: c. extinguishes the Flight Control LOW PRESSURE light when the Standby Rudder Shutoff Valve opens

question: How are System A and B reservoirs pressurized?
c: c. Accumulators

question: Main Hydraulic System A or B pressure is generated by ____.
a: a. an AC electric motor-driven pump only
c: c. a pneumatic pump
d: d. both an AC electric motor-driven pump and an engine-driven pump

question: An engine-driven hydraulic pump supplies approximately _____ times the fluid of an electric motordriven pump.
To block hydraulic fluid flow to the engine driven pump, ____.
a: a. turn the respective Engine Hydraulic Pump Switch to OFF
b: b. pull the respective engine Fire Handle
c: c. both A and B above are correct
d: d. none of the above are correct

question: Heat exchangers used for cooling hydraulic fluid are located ____.
a: a. in Main Fuel Tank #1 for System A
b: b. in Main Fuel Tank #2 for System B
c: c. in the center fuel tank for both systems
d: d. Both A and B are correct

question: With System A fluid level at the top of the standpipe, the reservoir quantity displayed indicates approximately ____ % full.
With fluid level at the top of the standpipe, fluid remaining in the System B reservoir is sufficient for operation of the ____.
c: c. Power Transfer Unit

question: The purpose of the Power Transfer Unit (PTU) is to ____.
a: a. supply hydraulic fluid volume needed to operate autoslats and leading edge flaps and slats
b: b. operate the landing gear after loss of System A
c: c. operate the alternate brakes after loss of System B
d: d. operate the alternate nosewheel steering after loss of System B

question: The Power Transfer Unit (PTU) operates automatically when ____.
a: a. System B engine-driven pump pressure drops below limits
c: c. flaps are less than 15 degrees but not up
d: d. all of the above occur

question: The Landing Gear Transfer Unit operates when ____.
a: a. airborne and No. 1 engine RPM drops below a limit value
b: b. the landing gear lever is positioned UP and a main gear is not up and locked
c: c. both of the above occur
d: d. none of the above occur

question: The automatic operation of the Standby Hydraulic System is initiated when all the following conditions exist:
a: a. Loss of system A or B pressure, flaps extended, airborne, or wheel speed greater than 60 knots.
b: b. Loss of system A and B pressure, flaps retracted airborne or wheel speed greater than 50 knots.
c: c. Loss of system A or B pressure, flaps extended, airborne, or wheel speed greater than 90 knots.
d: d. Loss of system A and B pressure, flaps retracted airborne, or wheel speed greater than 90 knots.

question: The Standby Hydraulic System LOW QUANTITY Light illuminates when the reservoir is ____.
c: c. approximately 1/4 empty

question: If a leak develops in Hydraulic System A engine-driven pump or its related lines, a ____ in the reservoir prevents a total system fluid loss.
c: c. one-way check valve

question: If a leak develops in Hydraulic System A electric motor-driven pump or its related lines, the hydraulic fluid quantity in the reservoir decreases to ____.
The Power Transfer Unit (PTU) uses ____ pressure to power a hydraulic motor-driven pump which pressurizes ____ fluid for use in operating leading edge flaps and slats.
c: c. System A, System B

question: The Power Transfer Unit operates automatically when ____.
a: a. flaps are less than 15 but not up
c: c. System B engine driven hydraulic pump pressure is below limits
d: d. all of the above occur

question: The minimum hydraulic System A and B pressure is ____ psi for preflight.
What happens if this light illuminates on takeoff, prior to gear retraction without engine failure?
a: a. The landing gear should retract at a normal rate.
b: b. The landing gear should retract at a slower rate since the electric motor-driven pump's fluid volume is ¼ of the engine-driven pump output.
c: c. The landing gear should retract normally through the Landing Gear Transfer Unit
d: d. The landing gear will not retract.

question: If the light is illuminated due to a leak in the #1 (System A) engine-driven pump, then System A quantity will ____
c: c. Show approximately 72%.

question: Both engines are still operating. Turning OFF the #1 Engine Hydraulic Pump Switch
a: a. will shut off fluid to the pump
b: b. will deactivate the pump Low Pressure light
c: c. does not affect the rotation of the pump
d: d. will stop the pump from rotating

question: Which of the following statements is true if the LOW PRESSURE light (right) illuminates in flight?
a: a. There is a leak in Hydraulic System B.
b: b. It the light is intermittent, then there is a heavy demand on System B.
c: c. Output pressure of System B electric motor-driven pump is low.
d: d. Output pressure of System B engine driven pump is low.

question: This light illuminates during takeoff, climbing through 1,000 feet AGL, and during flap retraction. Which statement below is most correct?
a: a. The leading edge devices will retract slowly because of the low volume output of the electric motor-driven pump.
b: b. The leading edge devices will retract at a normal rate through the PTU.
c: c. The leading edge devices will not retract.
d: d. The leading edge devices must be retracted using the Alternate Flap Switches.

question: How would this condition effect the flap operation prior to landing?
a: a. The PTU should automatically aid in extending the leading edge devices with the trailing edge flaps less than 15 degrees, but not up.
b: b. The PTU should aid in extending the leading edge flaps and slats, but the autoslats will be inoperative.
c: c. The PTU should not aid in extending the leading edge devices.
d: d. The PTU should automatically aid in extending the trailing edge devices.

question: With Hydraulic System B quantity near 0, what do these lights indicate?
a: a. System B is lost with no fluid left in the reservoir.
b: b. System B is lost with some fluid trapped in the reservoir.
c: c. System B pressure is normal but the Standby Hydraulic System is lost.
d: d. System B and the Standby Hydraulic System are lost.

question: When lowering the flaps with this condition, _____
a: a. the flaps will have to be lowered electrically with the aid of the PTU
b: b. the trailing edge flaps will be lowered electrically and the leading edge flaps and slats will be extended by the PTU
c: c. the trailing edge flaps and the leading edge devices will be extended using the Alternate Flap Extension method
d: d. Landing must be made with the flaps up

question: In addition to both lights (above) being illuminated, the airplane is airborne, flaps are extended, and the FLT CONTROL B Hydraulic System Switch is ON. Which of the following conditions is also true?
a: a. The Landing Gear Transfer Unit will operate.
b: b. Autopilot A will be inoperative.
c: c. Automatic operation of the Standby Hydraulic System will occur.
d: d. The Normal Brake System is available.

question: With these lights illuminated' and switches positioned as shown on the Hydraulic Panel, the pressure in Hydraulic System A should read __ psi.
____ is/are not available with no pressure in Hydraulic System A.
c: c. The elevator
d: d. Half of the flight spoilers and all of the ground spoilers

question: If on descent, how would the landing gear be lowered with this condition?
a: a. The gear can be lowered using Hydraulic System B through the landing gear transfer unit.
b: b. The gear can be lowered by the Standby Hydraulic System.
c: c. The gear will have to be lowered manually.
d: d. The gear cannot be lowered

question: In flight, what conditions could cause these two lights to illuminate?
a: a. The fluid used to cool and lubricate the Hydraulic System B electric-motor driven pump has overheated, or the pump itself has overheated.
b: b. The Hydraulic System B electric motor driven pump has overheated, but the fluid used to cool that pump is still below limits.
c: c. The fluid used to cool and lubricate the Hydraulic System B engine-driven pump has overheated, but the pump is still operating.
d: d. An overheat condition has been detected in Hydraulic System A.

question: When the overheat was detected in Hydraulic System B, what happens to the corresponding electric motor driven pump?
a: a. The pump continues to operate with normal pressure.
b: b. The pump continues to operate at a reduced pressure.
c: c. The pump shuts off automatically.
d: d. The pump will eventually destruct if not shut down by the crew manually.

question: The QRH directs the crew to switch the Hydraulic System B electric motor driven pump OFF. How will this affect the operation of the Power Transfer Unit (PTU)?
a: a. While in flight, the PTU assists in the operation of the autoslats and leading edge flaps and slats at a reduced rate.
b: b. The PTU would automatically operate with flaps less than 15 but not up.
c: c. The PTU would automatically operate if you are airborne.
d: d. System B electric motor driven pump pressure does not determine operation of the PTU.

question: These four lights are illuminated at the same lime. Choose the answer below that most accurately describes which hydraulic system(s) is/are lost?
c: c. Standby Hydraulic System only
d: d. Both Hydraulic System A and Hydraulic System B

question: Hydraulic Systems A and B are unavailable. How does this affect the Brake System?
b: b. Braking is available via trapped hydraulic pressure in the brake accumulator.
c: c. Braking is available via the Normal Brake System pressure.
d: d. Braking is available via the Alternate Brake System pressure.

question: With the same conditions, which primary flight control(s) will still be pressurized?
a: a. The rudder using the Standby Hydraulic System.
b: b. The elevators using the Standby Hydraulic System.
c: c. The ailerons using the Standby Hydraulic System.
d: d. The rudder, elevators and ailerons using the Standby Hydraulic System.

question: The crew suspects a leak in Hydraulic Systems B as indicated above. How would the trailing edge (TE) flaps be extended in flight under these conditions?
a: a. The TE flaps can be extended normally via the Standby Hydraulic System.
b: b. The TE flaps can be extended hydraulically from System A via the ALTERNATE FLAPS Position Switch
c: c. The TE flaps cannot be extended when Hydraulic System B is lost.
d: d. The TE flaps can be extended electrically via the ALTERNATE FLAP Position Switch.

question: After a few minutes, the crew notices that both Hydraulic Systems A and B are now unavailable as shown. How can the landing gear be extended prior to landing?
a: a. Only by using manual landing gear extension.
b: b. Normally via the Standby Hydraulic System.
c: c. Automatically via the Landing Gear Transfer Unit
d: d. The landing gear cannot be extended, and the QRH directs the crew to apply the Gear up Landing Procedure.

question: Both Hydraulic Systems A and B are still unavailable after landing. Select the answer which best describes the operation of the nose wheel steering in this condition.
a: a. It does not work without pressure from Hydraulic Systems A or B.
b: b. It will work using the Alternate Nose Wheel Steering selection.
c: c. It will work via the Nose Wheel Steering accumulator.
d: d. It will work via the Landing Gear Transfer Unit but with limited displacement in either direction.

question: If the standby hydraulic low quantity light is illuminated, ______.
a: a. at least half of the standby fluid has been depleted
b: b. the B system has decreased to the 50% level
c: c. the PTU has lost hydraulic fluid
d: d. this light only arms with the standby pump operating and indicates normal operation

question: This light is armed ______.
a: a. only when the standby pump is running
b: b. only when system B is pressurized
c: c. any time there is power on the aircraft
d: d. only when the engines are running

question: With this light illuminated, Hydraulic System B quantity should read __ %.
System A low pressure light is illuminated on the overhead panel. With this light on, how can the gear be extended?
a: a. Use the manual gear extension procedures.
c: c. Normal gear extension
d: d. The landing gear transfer unit will deploy the gear when normally extended.

question: With the A hydraulic system engine driven pump low pressure light on and indicating volume in the A reservoir.
a: a. you must lower the landing gear manually
b: b. you cannot retract the gear
c: c. gear will retract at a slower rate
d: d. only two spoilers on each wing work normally

question: With this light on during gear retraction, the landing gear transfer unit will activate with ______.
a: a. Low RPM on the #2 engine.
b: b. loss of Hydraulic System B
c: c. the loss of System A electric pump
d: d. low RPM on the #1 Engine

question: The anti-ice and rain system includes ____.
a: a. window heat, windshield wipers, probe and sensor heat
c: c. wing anti-ice

question: ____ flight deck windows are heated.
c: c. The #1 and #2.

question: Which cockpit window is not electrically heated?
c: c. #3 left & right

question: The rain removal system consists of ____.
b: b. rain repellant system including a reservoir located on the aft bulkhead
c: c. a permanent rain repellant coating on the window

question: Which of the following are electrically heated?
c: c. Pitot and TAT probes, angle of attack vanes, and static ports

question: The engine anti-ice system uses engine bleed air to prevent ice formation on the ____.
a: a. cowl, engine strut, and bullet nose
c: c. engine cowl and inlet guide vanes
d: d. inlet guide vanes, bullet nose, and cowl

question: The wing anti-ice system uses engine bleed air to prevent ice formation on ____.
a: a. leading edge flaps and all leading edge slats
c: c. three inboard leading edge slats

question: The amber COWL ANTI-ICE light illuminates because of ____.
a: a. low pressure in the duct leading to the cowl lip
b: b. bleed air overheat in the engine anti-ice duct
c: c. lack of bleed air flow to the cowl lip
d: d. excessive pressure in the duct leading to the cowl lip

question: A bright blue COWL VALVE OPEN light indicates ____.
a: a. related cowl anti-ice valve is in transit
b: b. cowl anti-ice valve position disagrees with related ENGINE ANTI-ICE Switch position
c: c. cowl anti-ice valve position agrees with related ENGINE ANTI-ICE Switch position

question: A dim blue COWL VALVE OPEN light indicates the ____.
b: b. valve position disagrees with the related ENGINE ANTI-ICE Switch position
c: c. valve is closed

question: A green TAI displayed above the N1 gauge indicates ____.
a: a. N1 thrust is adjusted for anti-ice operation
b: b. the cowl valve is closed
c: c. the cowl valve is open
d: d. the cowl valve is armed for automatic operation

question: A bright blue wing anti-ice VALVE OPEN light indicates ____.
a: a. related wing anti-ice control valve is in transit
b: b. wing anti-ice control valve position disagrees with WING ANTI ICE Switch position
c: c. wing anti-ice control valve is open
d: d. both A and B above

question: The FWD window heat switch controls heat to which window(s)?
What happens if an overheat condition is detected in windows #1 or #2?
c: c. The system resets and automatically runs the OVHT test.

question: On the ground with the WING ANTI-ICE switch ON, both anti-ice control valves close if ____.
a: a. thrust on either engine is above the setting for takeoff warning activation
b: b. temperature inside both wing distribution ducts is less than thermal switch activation
c: c. either A or B occur

question: Wing Anti-Ice should be used on the ground in icing conditions unless ____.
a: a. Type I fluid has been applied
b: b. Type II or IV fluid has been applied
c: c. hot water has been used to remove wing ice
d: d. Type III fluid has been applied

question: If required, after takeoff, wing anti-ice should not be turned ON below ____.
b: b. 2000 feet AFL or obstacle clearance, whichever is greater
c: c. 800 feet AGL or obstacle clearance, whichever is greater

question: In flight activation of ENGINE ANTI-ICE Switches will cause ____.
a: a. stick shaker logic to be set for icing conditions
b: b. activation of engine ignition (selector AUTO)
c: c. adjustment of engine idle to approach idle
d: d. all of the above to occur

question: In flight the Wing Anti-ice Switch is turned OFF after having been on, the result is _________.
b: b. stick shaker logic returns to normal
c: c. stick shaker logic remains set for icing conditions
d: d. none of the above are correct

question: If the cowl anti-ice valve fails to open when the ENGINE ANTI-ICE Switch is placed to ON, ____.
a: a. the COWL VALVE OPEN light illuminates bright blue
b: b. the amber TAI indication illuminates above the N1 display
c: c. the COWL VALVE OPEN light changes to dim blue
d: d. both A and B above are correct

question: Engine anti-ice must be on during flight operations in all icing conditions except climb and cruise with temperatures below ____ degrees C.
(MAX) Core Anti-Ice:
a: a. Is applied by placing the Engine Anti-Ice switch to ON.
b: b. Is inoperative if the ENGINE ANTI-ICE light is illuminated.
c: c. The EECs automatically control the core anti-ice system.
d: d. Both b and c above.

question: The landing gear is normally extended and retracted by which hydraulic system?
c: c. LGTU

question: Parking brakes can utilize pressure from ____.
c: c. Standby system

question: In the event the #1 engine fails, normal retraction of the landing gear is not available; however, the gear will be retracted by ____.
b: b. the Landing Gear Transfer Unit
c: c. the PTU

question: The Landing Gear Transfer Unit provides for gear retraction in the event of a failure of the ____.
c: c. Hydraulic System B

question: In the event of system A loss and landing gear are up, the gear may be extended by ____.
c: c. hydraulic standby system
d: d. the landing gear override switch

question: The override trigger, located on the underside of the gear handle, can be used to override ____.
a: a. a hydraulic lock which might prevent normal extension of the gear
b: b. the mechanical uplocks in case the hydraulic system is unable
c: c. electrical downlocks if they fail

question: Under normal operations, gear green lights illuminated means the ____.
a: a. related gear is down and locked
b: b. gear is not locked in the up position
c: c. LANDING GEAR Lever is OFF, and the gear is down and locked
d: d. gear is down and locked, irrespective of the gear handle position

question: What stops wheel rotation when the gear is raised?
a: a. Snubbers stop the mains, and wheel brakes are applied to the nose wheels.
b: b. Wheel brakes are applied to all wheels.
c: c. A snubber on the nosewheel, and wheel brakes are applied to the main wheels.
d: d. Centrifugal force and friction stop all wheels.

question: With RTO selected, if the takeoff is rejected and throttles reduced to idle ____, maximum braking is applied.
c: c. at or above 80 knots

question: The maximum speed allowed while the gear is extended is _____ KIAS.
A fault in the Parking Brake System may cause the ____________________to illuminate.
c: c. ANTISKID INOP Light
d: d. red Landing Gear Indicator Lights

question: On gear extension, the left red gear light remains on with no green light. What action will you take?
b: b. Slow to 230 knots and recycle the gear.
c: c. Declare an emergency and land.
d: d. Check the overhead panel for gear indication prior to other procedures.

question: The overhead panel shows all the gear lights green. This indicates the left main is ____.
c: c. up

question: The overhead panel does not show a green light for the left main. What statement is true?
a: a. The left main is down and locked.
b: b. The right main is not down and locked.
c: c. The left main is not down and locked.
d: d. The right main is unsafe.

question: With a loss of hydraulic system A and B (all pump low pressure lights illuminated), _____.
a: a. anti-skid will not operate correctly
b: b. anti-skid protection will be available on outboard wheels only
c: c. there is no anti-skid protection when breaking with accumulator only
d: d. brakes will still use the normal anti-skid system

question: If anti-skid system still functions normally with the loss of hydraulic systems A and B, the auto-brake system ______.
c: c. works, but the anti-skid system is inop

question: The brake pressure indicator reads as shown (3000 psi) after the loss of Hydraulic Systems A and B. What type of problem does this indicate?
a: a. There is too much pressure to the brakes, and they should be bled to 1000 psi.
b: b. The brake accumulator was not pre-charged correctly.
c: c. This indication is normal.
d: d. The indicator should only indicate a pre-charged pressure of 1000 psi, and is therefore inop.

question: With the Gear Handle up after takeoff, these lights are illuminated. What is the most likely problem?
a: a. The left gear pin was left installed.
b: b. The nose gear pin was left installed.
c: c. Tread separation, on a right tire, impacted a fitting on the wheel well ring.
d: d. Number one engine driven pump was lost.

question: With the damaged tire sensor broken, the right main gear _____.
a: a. will have to be raised with the aid of the PTU
b: b. can be raised through the gear transfer unit
c: c. will not retract

question: If the crew decides to return to the departure field, ________
a: a. they will have to land with anti-skid inoperative
b: b. landing is made with a normal gear configuration
c: c. the right main will be retracted for landing
d: d. they will make a gear up landing

question: (MAX) The “OFF” position on the Landing Gear Lever is no longer required since:
a: a. Previous Hydraulic extend and retract system now replaced with electric motors.
b: b. There are no mechanical connections with the valve system.
c: c. Pressure automatically removed 10 seconds after all gear up and locked.
d: d. Both b. and c above.

question: The IRS display unit is located on the ____.
c: c. Captain`s Side Panel

question: How long does a full IRS alignment take?
c: c. Approximately 15 minutes
d: d. From 5-17 minutes depending on latitude.

question: A steady white ALIGN light on the IRS Display Unit means ____.
a: a. an alignment fault is detected
b: b. the present position is inaccurate
c: c. alignment is progressing normally
d: d. the system is fully aligned

question: A flashing white ALIGN light means ____.
c: c. both A and B are correct
d: d. alignment complete, ready for NAV

question: How long can the Right IRS operate without AC electrical power?
c: c. 5 seconds

question: If the amber FAULT light illuminates on the IRS Display Unit, it indicates the ____.
a: a. IRS has switched to ATTITUDE automatically
c: c. ADIRU is in a self-test mode
d: d. related IRS system has detected a fault

question: In flight, attitude information may be restored following a fault by selecting ____.
c: c. NAV

question: The VOR course is set on the ____.
c: c. Aft Electronics Panel

question: The VOR identification is displayed on the ____.
c: c. on-side FMC

question: The right VOR information can be displayed and flown on the left ND by changing the ____.
a: a. VOR Standby Switch on the Aft Electronics Panel
b: b. IRS Switch on the FWD Overhead Panel
c: c. VHF NAV Transfer Switch on the FWD Overhead Panel
d: d. AUX NAV Switch on the Aft Overhead Panel

question: DME frequencies are normally _____ tuned by the _____ as necessary for aircraft position updating.
c: c. automatically/GPS

question: ____ ILS receiver(s) is/are installed on the B737.
ILS course and glidepath are displayed on the pilots PFDs and ____.
a: a. Nav Display in MAP mode
c: c. Standby Attitude Indicator

question: Marker beacon information is displayed on ____.
c: c. both the PFD and ND

question: ____ GPS receivers are installed in the B737.
GPS provides position updates to the ____ and other aircraft systems.
c: c. ILS

question: The white ALIGN light will flash to indicate ____.
a: a. an error in initial position information
b: b. the IRS Mode Selector has been moved to OFF
c: c. normal alignment
d: d. alignment complete, ready for NAV

question: The right (IRS #2) ON DC light has illuminated. What is/are the possible causes?
b: b. AC Main Bus 1 has failed.
c: c. The left IRS is being powered by the DC Standby Bus.
d: d. The airplane is on standby power.

question: This indication occurs at the gate because external power dropped off line and the aircraft is now on standby power. Select all of the indications (below) that would also be applicable.
a: a. The Master Caution and IRS annunciator lights illuminate
b: b. The ground call horn in the nose wheel well sounds.
c: c. The BAT DISCHARGE light illuminates
d: d. TRANSFER BUS OFF and SOURCE OFF lights illuminate.

question: In this situation, the indication occurs in flight. Assuming no corrective action is available, which statement about the operation of each IRS is correct?
a: a. The left IRS is inoperative. The right IRS is operating on battery power.
b: b. The left IRS will operate on battery power once the right IRS shuts down after 5 minutes.
c: c. The left IRS is operating normally. The right IRS will shut down in 5 minutes.
d: d. The right IRS will operate for 30 minutes and the left IRS will shut down in 5 minutes.

question: In flight, the Master Caution Lights and the IRS Annunciation light illuminate. The indications to the right also occur which means that the _____.
a: a. Left IRS has failed and the unit is inoperative.
b: b. Battery Bus has failed since it is the DC power source for the left IRS
c: c. DC power source 1or the left IRS is not normal but the left IRS is still powered by the AC Standby
d: d. left IRS should continue to operate for 5 minutes and then fail

question: Assuming no other IRS lights are illuminated, normal IRS operation can be restored by ____.
a: a. moving the left IRS Mode Selector to ALIGN and then back to NAV after 30 seconds
b: b. No action is possible. The left IRS will fail after 5 minutes
c: c. moving the left IRS Mode Selector to ATT and update the aircraft heading in line 5R in POS INIT Page 1/3 of the CDU
d: d. No action is required. The IRS is operating normally

question: What is the back-up DC power source for the Left IRS?
a: a. The Switched Hot Battery Bus
c: c. The DC Standby Bus
d: d. A 24-volt DC battery separate of the aircraft battery that has a 30-minute life span

question: The aircraft is in level flight at FL 350 when this indication is observed. The left IRS Transfer Switch is in the NORMAL position. In this situation, the Left IRS is not providing accurate _____.
a: a. information to the Captain's instruments and the left IRS must be turned OFF
b: b. Attitude and heading information to the Captain's instruments. To restore attitude information, select ATT on the #1 IRS Mode Selector and maintain wings level and constant airspeed tor 30 seconds
c: c. Information to the Captain's instruments. To restore the system, select ALIGN on the #1 IRS Mode Selector, then select NAV after the ALIGN Light extinguishes (approximately 30 seconds)
d: d. Heading and attitude information to both the Captain's and First Officer's instruments. Move the IRS Transfer Switch to BOTH ON R to restore the FO's information

question: The QRH directs you to place the #1 IRS Mode Selector to ATT. Once in this mode, the left IRS does not calculate.
a: a. acceleration or vertical speed, thus MAX deceleration should be selected on AUTO BRAKE Select Switch
b: b. Position, ground speed, track, or winds. Heading is available after the ALIGN light is extinguished (approximately 30 seconds)
c: c. acceleration, vertical speed, ground speed, track, position, heading, and winds

question: To continue operations with the IRS Mode Selector Unit in this configuration, you must
a: a. Monitor aircraft heading using a different source and periodically enter corrected heading in the CDU POS INIT Page or by selecting HDG/STS on the IRS Display Unit.
b: b. Do nothing. The CDU will update corrected heading automatically from the ISFD
c: c. Monitor aircraft heading using a different source and periodically reset corrected heading in the CDU POS INIT page. Also, select BOTH ON R with the IRS Transfer Switch
d: d. Shut the left IRS off. Heading Information cannot be updated

question: With the indications in flight on the left IRS panel, you should place the #1 IRS Mode Selector to ___.
a: a. ALIGN while maintaining wings level for approximately 30 seconds, then move the selector back to NAV to regain attitude information
b: b. ATT while maintaining wings level for approximately 30 seconds, then move the selector back to NAV to regain attitude information
c: c. OFF momentarily, then move the selector back to NAV and maintain wings level and constant airspeed for approximately 30 seconds to regain attitude information
d: d. ATT while maintaining wings level and constant airspeed for approximately 30 seconds and leave the IRS in ATT mode

question: 30 seconds after placing the #1 IRS Mode Selector to ATT the FAULT Light extinguishes. Mag compass heading is 1To enter and regain current aircraft heading the crew should enter ______.
a: a. 127 degrees in Line 5R (SET IRS HDG) of POS INIT Page 1 of the CDU
b: b. 117 degrees in Line SR (SET IRS HDG) of POS INIT Page 1 of the CDU
c: c. the corrected Latitude and Longitude provided from the operating IRS in Line 1 R (LAST POS) of POS INIT Page 1 of the CDU
d: d. the Reference Airport in line 1 L (REF AIRPORT) of POS INIT Page 1 of the CDU

question: In this scenario, which statement below most accurately describes flight limitations with the aircraft in this configuration?
a: a. Cat II and/or Cat Ill approaches are not authorized.
b: b. Neither autopilot can be engaged.
c: c. Alternate brakes are not available.
d: d. Land ASAP before the backup DC power source from the Switched Hot Battery Bus depletes (minimum 30 minutes).

question: What information can be concluded by these indications while the aircraft is at the gate?
a: a. The left IRS is not affected by this failure, however backup DC power has failed.
b: b. The left IRS is being powered by the Switched Hot Battery Bus.
c: c. The right IRS has failed after being powered by the Switched Hot Battery Bus for more than 10 minutes.
d: d. Not enough information has been provided on the status of the left and right IRS Units.

question: While still at the gate you confirm that external power is connected. What additional conclusion can be made based on the indications shown for the left IRS panel?
a: a. The right IRS is unpowered.
b: b. The ground-call horn in the nose wheel well will not activate since normal AC power is on the busses.
c: c. The left IRS is powered by the AC Standby Bus.
d: d. AC power to the number 1 IRS has failed.

question: While the aircraft is still parked at the gate, another possible explanation for the indication above would be that _____.
a: a. the ELEC Light is also illuminated due to a fault in the DC power system
b: b. this is a normal momentary indication during an IRS alignment sell-test
c: c. the Battery Switch is OFF
d: d. the STANDBY POWER Switch is in BAT

question: The Flight Crew Oxygen Pressure Indicator is located on the ____.
c: c. Left Forward Panel

question: The flow options on the crew oxygen mask regulator are ____.
c: c. Emerg, Normal, and 100%

question: The minimum recommended oxygen pressure for dispatch is ____ psi.
Passenger oxygen is supplied from ____.
a: a. one large high pressure oxygen tank located in the aft cargo compartment
b: b. two large high pressure oxygen tanks located below the flight deck
c: c. chemical oxygen generators for each PSU
d: d. a high pressure bottle for each bank of masks

question: Passenger oxygen masks are deployed ____.
a: a. Automatically with cabin altitude of 14,000 ft.
b: b. manually when the Passenger Oxygen Switch is placed to ON
c: c. manually when Oxygen Deploy Lever is pulled
d: d. both A and B above

question: Passenger oxygen provides a continuous flow for approximately ___ minutes.
How many oxygen masks are located above each set of passenger seats? ____ Each flight attendant station? ____.
____ will cause the PASS OXY ON light to illuminate in the cockpit.
b: b. Manual activation of the passenger oxygen masks
c: c. Both A and B

question: The TPS provides ____ for takeoff.
a: a. thrust settings, flap settings, and MEL/CDL corrections
c: c. Airport Analysis data

question: The TPS does account for ____.
c: c. contaminated runways

question: Under the Thrust/V-speed section runway designators, up to a maximum of ____ runways may be shown on the TPS.
The tailwind correction under the Runway Limits column of the Airport Analysis is showing "N/A." This means that ____.
a: a. takeoff with a tailwind is not authorized on that runway
b: b. zero deviation is allowed from the planned headwind
c: c. the tailwind data has not been loaded into the TPS
d: d. the maximum tailwind component is authorized with no weight adjustment required

question: ____ requires maximum takeoff thrust at the 26K rating.
c: c. Engine anti-ice ON

question: If the temperature on the TPS is colder than ____ degrees C, the Airport Analysis section will show Engine Anti-ice corrections for the Climb and Runway limits.
Authorized flap settings for takeoff are ____.
A runway should be considered contaminated when more than ____ % of the required field length within the width being used is covered by standing water, slush, or wet snow more than ____ inches deep.
It is recommended to use Flaps ____ for takeoffs on contaminated runways to minimize the takeoff speed.
The maximum takeoff weight is ____ lbs.
The maximum landing weight is ____ lbs.
For a Flaps 15 landing, add 10 knots to VREF if ____.
a: a. engine anti-ice will be used during landing
b: b. wing anti-ice has been used anytime during flight
c: c. icing conditions were encountered during flight and the landing temperature is colder than 10 degrees C
d: d. any of the above occur

question: The Boeing 737-800 uses pneumatic air from which of the following sources?
a: a. Engine bleed air, accumulator air, APU bleed air
b: b. Ram air, external air, accumulator air
c: c. Ram air, engine bleed air, APU bleed air
d: d. Engine bleed air, external air, APU bleed air

question: Bleed air from the engines comes from what compressor stages?
c: c. 5th and 9th

question: The ____ systems rely on pneumatic pressure for operation.
a: a. engine starting, air conditioning/pressurization, wing and engine anti-ice, hydraulic, water tank pressurization, and TAT probe
b: b. APU, engine starting, air conditioning, and aspirated TAT probe
c: c. air conditioning/pressurization, wing anti-ice, APU
d: d. wing anti-ice, APU, engine starting, air conditioning

question: ____ cause(s) the engine bleed valve to automatically close.
c: c. Neither over pressure nor over temperature will
d: d. Either over pressure or over temperature

question: Illumination of the amber BLEED TRIP OFF light indicates what valve has automatically closed?
c: c. Corresponding APU shutoff valve

question: When the APU is shut down, the APU bleed valve ___________.
b: b. must be closed manually by placing the APU bleed air switch to OFF
c: c. closes automatically regardless of APU bleed air switch position
d: d. will close when the second engine is started

question: The APU bleed air valve will close if ____.
a: a. the APU Bleed Air Switch is placed OFF or if the APU is shutdown
b: b. APU overheat or overpressure occur
c: c. engine bleed air is available
d: d. engine bleed air is supplying the wing anti-ice system

question: When starting engines with a ground air source, external air pressure should be ____ psi.
c: c. maximum of 25

question: During normal operations, if the Isolation Valve switch is in AUTO, then the valve ____.
c: c. varies due to pressure demands
d: d. varies due to temperature fluctuations

question: When the Isolation Valve Switch is in AUTO, the valve will open automatically if ____.
a: a. a pack switch is placed OFF
b: b. an engine bleed switch is placed OFF
c: c. a pack moves to high flow
d: d. either A or B occur

question: BLEED TRIP OFF light would illuminate for ____.
c: c. 5th stage valve stuck open

question: The right WING BODY OVERHEAT light indicates a duct leak in the ____.
a: a. right engine strut, right wing outboard leading edge, keel beam, or right air conditioning bay
b: b. right engine strut, right wing inboard leading edge, or right air conditioning bay
c: c. right engine strut, right wing outboard leading edge, or right forward cargo bay
d: d. right wing inboard leading edge, right forward cargo bay, or keel beam

question: The left WING BODY OVERHEAT light indicates a duct leak in the left engine strut, left wing leading edge, left air conditioning bay, and ____.
b: b. APU duct and mix manifold
c: c. keel beam duct and forward cargo area
d: d. APU duct and keel beam ducting

question: A bleed air duct leak in the __ will cause this light to illuminate.
a: a. Left engine strut. right inboard wing leading edge, or the left air conditioning bay
b: b. left engine strut, left inboard wing leading edge, left air conditioning bay, keel beam, or the APU bleed air duct
c: c. left engine cowling or left inboard wing leading edge
d: d. anti-ice duct outboard of the left engine or the APU bleed air duct

question: Pushing the TRIP RESET switch will reset the WING-BODY OVERHEAT light _____.
a: a. if the light was caused by high pressure only
b: b. if the light was caused by high temperature only
c: c. Never. This light cannot be reset with the TRIP RESET Switch
d: d. if the light was caused by either high temperature or high pressure

question: The QRH directs the crew to close the Isolation valve, turn off the pack, close the engine bleed on the affected side, and turn off the wing anti-ice. Accomplishing these procedures will ____.
a: a. isolate bleed air to the left pack while still allowing air to flow to the left wing anti-ice duct
b: b. prevent air from the #1 engine entering the left bleed air duct but still allows air to the left pack
c: c. prevent air from the #1 engine entering the left bleed air duct and to shutoff all bleed air to \he left side
d: d. stop all bleed air tram flowing to the right side

question: The aircraft is climbing through 5,000 ft when this light illuminated. What caused this light to illuminate?
a: a. Wing anti-ice is ON and an overheat condition has occurred in the wing.
b: b. Engine #2 anti-ice is ON and an overheat has occurred in the cowl lip.
c: c. An overheat or an overpressure condition has occurred in the #2 engine bleed air duct.
d: d. The left pack has overheated. The right pack was unable to meet pressure demands and tripped off.

question: What happened when this light illuminated in flight?
a: a. The #2 engine bleed air valve closes automatically.
b: b. The isolation valve was open but will now close automatically.
c: c. The #2 engine bleed air valve will close only if the duct temperature reaches a predetermined limit.
d: d. The bleed air valve does not close with a bleed trip.

question: The flaps were retracted in flight when this light illuminated. The QRH directs the crew to RESET the tripped bleed. The BLEED TRIP OFF Light remains illuminated. The QRH then directs the crew to turn OFF the Right A/C Pack Switch. Therefore, the _____.
a: a. left pack switches to “high air flow" mode after the isolation valve closes
b: b. right pack switches to "high air flow mode after the isolation valve opens
c: c. left pack remains shut down and the right pack switches to "high air flow” mode
d: d. right pack remains shut down and the left pack switches to "high air flow" mode

question: While in level flight at FL350 with the WING ANTI-ICE Switch ON, the amber lights shown on the right illuminate. Which location could be the source of the bleed air leak?
c: c. Right-Hand Air Conditioning Bay

question: These illuminated amber lights, confirm the existence of a bleed air leak. The Wing Anti-lce Switch is ON. What is the first corrective action step in this circumstance?
a: a. Turn OFF the BLEED Air Switch on the affected side.
c: c. Turn OFF the Air Conditioning PACK Switch on the affected side.
d: d. Select the WING ANTI-ICE Switch to OFF.

question: Which statement below most accurately describes what will happen when you press the TRIP RESET Switch in this scenario?
a: a. The Right WING-BODY OVERHEAT Light will extinguish if the problem has been corrected.
c: c. The Right WING-BODY OVERHEAT Light will extinguish momentarily, then re-illuminate if the problem still exists.
d: d. The Left Air Conditioning Pack will regulate to high flow if the flaps are up.

question: What would cause this light to illuminate?
a: a. #2 Bleed Switch ON, Isolation Valve Closed, and APU Bleed Valve Open
b: b. Isolation Valve Open and APU Bleed Valve Closed
c: c. #1 and #2 Bleed Switches ON, APU Valve Open, and Isolation Valve Open
d: d. #1 and #t2 Engine Bleed Switches OFF

question: What are the restrictions when this light is ON?
b: b. Two packs and one bleed source cannot be operated simultaneously.
c: c. Throttles idle, if #1 Engine Bleed Open, or #2 Engine Bleed Open and Isolation Valve Open.
d: d. The APU and either engine cannot be run at the same time.

question: We can operate a single engine taxi (On #2 Engine) with a dual bleed light on by _____.
a: a. ensuring duct pressure is less than 30 psi
b: b. Remaining parked. Single Engine Taxi is not allowed
c: c. closing the isolation valve

question: A bleed air duct leak is indicated by a ____ light.
c: c. BLEED TRIP OFF

question: The APU bleed valve must be closed if ____.
a: a. Engine 1 is running above idle and its bleed air valve is open
b: b. Engine 2 is running above idle, its bleed air valve is open, and the isolation valve is open
c: c. external air is connected with the isolation valve open

question: A DUAL BLEED light will illuminate when ____.
a: a. the APU bleed air valve is open and Engine 1 Bleed Switch is ON
b: b. the APU bleed air valve is open, Engine 2 Bleed Switch is ON, and the isolation valve is open
c: c. external air is connected and the isolation valve is open
d: d. either A or B occurs

question: (MAX) How is the operation of the bleed air system managed?
c: c. Pneumatically controlled
d: d. Air temperature flow shutoff valves

question: (MAX) BLEED Light illuminates for:
c: c. System fault or failure.
d: d. Both b and c above.

question: (MAX) PACK Light Illuminates for:
c: c. Both pack switches are in the OFF position 45 seconds after flap retraction on takeoff.
d: d. Both a and c above.

question: (MAX) Features of MAX Bleed Air System:
a: a. System allows operation of both packs from a single bleed air source.
b: b. System has been upgraded to a Digital Bleed Air Supply which automatically detects and isolates faults.
c: c. Engine Bleed air is only required if the new, more powerful APU is not operating while airborne.
d: d. Both a and b above.

question: (MAX) If smoke is detected within the equipment cooling system, what amber caution light(s) will illuminate?
b: b. Equip Smoke and Master Caution
c: c. Smoke and Master Caution

question: Normally, air is discharged overboard to maintain cabin pressure through the ____.
c: c. outflow valve

question: At a normal pressure differential, the cabin can maintain _____ ft. altitude with an aircraft altitude of 41,000 ft.
The Auto Pressurization System consists of ____ identical controllers with ____ controller(s) alternately sequenced as (the) primary operational unit(s) for each new flight.
For the pressurization auto controller to function properly, ____ is required to be preset.
a: a. cruise altitude and takeoff altitude
c: c. landing altitude and cruise altitude

question: To switch the pressurization to the auto alternate controller, you ____.
a: a. must select STBY, then back to AUTO on the Cabin Pressurization Panel
b: b. cannot switch to alternate; pressurization controllers can only be sequenced automatically
c: c. must select MAN, then back to AUTO on the Cabin Pressurization Panel
d: d. must select ALTN on the Cabin Pressurization Panel

question: The AUTO FAIL light will illuminate automatically due to ____.
a: a. cabin altitude in excess of 10,000'
c: c. any of the above occurring
d: d. cabin rate of change in excess of +/- 1000 ft/min or cabin altitude in excess of 14,000 feet

question: When the pressurization AUTO FAIL light illuminates and the ALTN light does not, which statement is true?
a: a. Both auto channels have failed.
b: b. An AC STBY BUS failure.
c: c. Cabin altitude 14,000

question: The OFF SCHEDULE DESCENT light illuminates. This is caused by the ____.
a: a. auto controller allowing the cabin to climb/descend at an excessive rate
c: c. pilot starting a descent prior to reaching selected cruise altitude
d: d. auto controller not keeping up with the pressurization demands

question: If an OFF SCHEDULE DESCENT light comes on, the pressurization system will ____.
a: a. recompute the new cruise altitude psi differential rate
b: b. return the cabin to the last cruise altitude
c: c. pressurize the cabin back to the takeoff airport altitude
d: d. reschedule the pressurization rate of change

question: The pressurization outflow VALVE position indicator operates in ____ mode(s).
c: c. MANUAL

question: When operating cabin pressure in MANUAL, the third DC motor operates ____.
b: b. on AC power, not DC
c: c. slower

question: The safety pressure relief valves open at ____ psi.
The automatic cabin pressure control system descent mode is activated when ____. Select the most correct answer.
a: a. the aircraft begins descent from the top of descent
b: b. the aircraft descends 0.25 psi below the selected value in the Flight Altitude (FLT ALT) Indicator.
c: c. over halfway to the destination airport and the selected value in the Landing Altitude (LAND ALT) Indicator is changed
d: d. either A or B occurs

question: If the external atmospheric pressure exceeds the internal cabin pressure, the ____ will open.
c: c. outflow valve

question: This light will illuminate tor all of the following conditions EXCEPT _____.
b: b. controller or outflow valve control fault
c: c. cabin altitude at 14,000 feet
d: d. excessive ratio of cabin pressure change (+12,000 sea level feet/minute)

question: This illuminated light on the Cabin Pressurization Panel indicates that _____
a: a. the primary controller has failed and the system has switched to the other auto controller (ALTN Mode)
b: b. the back-up auto controller (ALTN Mode) is unavailable if the primary controller should fail
c: c. neither pressure controller has failed
d: d. both pressure controllers have failed

question: In this situation, the QRH directs placing the pressurization mode in ALTN. What indications should you have after this step is accomplished?
a: a. The AUTO FAIL and ALTN lights remain illuminated.
b: b. The AUTO FAIL light remains illuminated and the ALTN light extinguishes.
c: c. The AUTO FAIL light extinguishes and the ALTN light remains illuminated.
d: d. Both the AUTO FAIL and Al TN lights extinguish.

question: After moving the Pressurization Mode Selector to ALT per the QRH, the AUTO FAIL light remains illuminated. The QRH now directs to move this switch to MAN. What affect does this step have on the pressurization system?
a: a. The manual controller moves the outflow valve at the same rate as the auto controllers.
b: b. The manual controller moves the outflow valve at a slower rate than the auto controllers.
c: c. The manual controller moves the outflow valve at a faster rate than the auto controllers.
d: d. All three controllers use the same motor to operate the outflow valve.

question: In flight, at 29,000 ft, these lights illuminate on the Cabin Pressurization Panel. What is the status of the pressurization controllers?
a: a. The standby auto controller has failed and the primary auto controller is maintaining pressure.
b: b. Both the primary and standby auto pressure controllers have failed.
c: c. The primary auto controller has failed and the system did not automatically switch to ALTN Mode.
d: d. The primary auto controller has failed and the system has automatically switched to the standby auto controller (ALTN Mode).

question: How does this condition affect the operation of the pressurization system?
a: a. The maximum pressure differential is less since we are using the standby auto controller.
b: b. The pressure differential is being maintained at the pressure relief valve limit.
c: c. The outflow valve will operate slower with the standby auto controller.
d: d. There is no difference in operation when using the standby auto controller.

question: The crew has elected to return to the departure airport. During descent, this light illuminates on the Cabin Pressurization Panel. What other crew action is required in conjunction with this light being on?
a: a. No other action is required.
b: b. The crew must change landing altitude only.
c: c. The crew must change flight altitude only.
d: d. The crew must change both flight altitude and landing altitude.

question: The departure airport is now closed for weather and the crew elects to fly to an alternate destination at a flight altitude lower than planned. With this light on, the crew should _________.
a: a. leave the pressurization panel as it is.
b: b. change the FLT ALT window but not the LAND ALT window
c: c. change the LAND ALT window but not the FLT ALT window
d: d. change both the FLT ALT and LAND ALT windows

question: What is the reason why this light originally illuminated?
a: a. The aircraft started descent prior to reaching the hallway point in the route.
b: b. The aircraft started descent prior to flying 400 NM.
c: c. The aircraft started descent prior to reaching the cruise altitude set in the FLT ALT window.
d: d. The aircraft started descent prior to reaching the altitude set in the LAND ALT window.

question: When operating on standby electrical power (battery only), the ____ cabin pressure controller is available.
c: c. manual

question: In the WX/T (turbulence) mode, a turbulence display is available on displays of ____ nm or less.
The weather radar GAIN Control sets gain in the ____ modes.
c: c. MAP and IDNT

question: The weather radar system is capable of detecting and issuing windshear events (predictive windshear) ____.
b: b. within 3 NM of the aircraft
c: c. before the aircraft enters the area of windshear
d: d. in all of the above locations

question: The strongest weather radar reflectivity echoes are produced by ____.
c: c. snow

question: The yellow level of precipitation indicates ____.
c: c. strong reflectivity/heavy rainfall

question: Magenta color radar returns indicate ____.
c: c. terrain

question: Predictive windshear warnings come from ______________.
c: c. Predictive Windshear Detection Electronic Unit (PWDEU)
